It is a powerful empire, founded several hundred years ago by a mythical ruler, allegedly a descendant of the gods. Zhongguo became the greatest military power, economic and economical, which exists in this part of the world. Wuhan is the capital of the empire - a huge metropolis called the City of a Thousand Dreams. In its center is a great palace, from which the crude hand of his subjects speak the Emperor, the Son of Light.

Far to the north of Wuhan is Tsiengtao, the seat of a small family Hunyuian. The city is, until recently, was one of many provincial estates, the situation changed, however, several years ago, shortly after the Civil War, which was consuming Zhongguo. There came the most famous masters of martial arts styles and built their own schools here. Since then Tsiengtao is called the City of a Thousand Warriors.

It is in Tsiengtao where action takes place. This is an extremely powerful urban center, filled with magnificent buildings, such as Tsiengtao Brewery, the first in the whole empire, Eglantine Gardens or Dragon's Cavern. In Tsiengtao and the surrounding area has the largest number of martial arts schools throughout the empire - twenty-three. In the Middle Kingdom there are two hundreds of them, therefore Tsiengtao features over one-tenth of them. That's why the city is called the City of a Thousand Warriors.

Part of New Style in Poland.

87589.description:
From the FFG Website:

"Oksana is a former Archimandrite, defeated at the hands of the reincarnated god that she refused to bow to. Now she’s back to cause a split within the Matriarchy, the powerful faction introduced in the Operation Novgorod expansion. Just as likely to side with the Union as she is with the Matriarcy on her path to vengeance, Oksana is a powerful ally or a dangerous foe, depending on where you stand in her eyes.

Oksana utilizes the mechanical drones known as Voïvodes, which are utilized heavily in Operation Novgorod. These Voïvodes operate under Oksana’s control, doing her bidding without hesitation.

Oksana comes complete with a detailed pre-painted figure of Oksana Gusarenko, two pre-painted Voïvode miniatures, two character sheets, and tokens for all of her equipment. Oksana has the ability to field two Voïvodes when she is chosen as a hero. Players wishing to utilize Oksana’s technological talents must replace one of their Troopers with her two Voïvodes. She cannot be used on the same team as Zor’ka from the Operation Novgorod expansion.

In addition to these components, Oksana also comes with a rulebook featuring a custom scenario that sends her into Reich territory on a quest to recover lost documents."
87589.name: Tannhäuser: Oksana

87590.name: Legends of the Samurai: The Campaign Guide
87590.description:
From publisher blurb:

"If you are slain in battle, you should be resolved to have your corpse facing the enemy"
-Yamamoto Tsunetomo

Extensively researched and faithfully rendered, Legends of the Samurai provides all the mechanics for adventuring in the world of medieval Japan. This extensive tome presents players with over twenty new oriental classes, an alternative magic system, a historically based martial arts system, and a flavorful system for fate and destiny. For gamemasters, Legends of the Samurai offers a detailed campaign guide, including NPC statistics, color maps, and historical information on medieval Japan.

Now is the time to make your own legend.

87591.name: Legends of the Samurai: The Bushido Handbook
87591.description:
From Introduction:
Welcome to a land that never was. A land of flashing blades, resolute honor and vile betrayals. A land where wandering ronin prey on helpless travelers… or seek a return to honor. A land where lone samurai undertake suicide missions to satisfy honor. A land ruled by a God but whose fate will be decided by steel. A land that has been the subject of poems, novels, films and video games. A land that has held the world in fascination for centuries.

A land of contrast: peaceful serenity and constant warfare, honor and betrayal. A land continually at war for centuries, where a martial ethos and devastating tactical prowess evolved that continue to shape modern combat philosophies to this day.

Japan, Land of the Rising Sun.

87592.name: Legends of the Samurai: The Mystic Arts
87592.description:
From Introduction:
Welcome to Legends of the Samurai: the Mystic Handbook, the second installment in the Legends of the Samurai series. For all of you who read the first book and hated it… well, you’re probably not reading this. But for those of you who read the first book and loved it, but proclaimed, “What, no magic?!”—this book is for you.

Legends of the Samurai brings the mystical world of medieval Japan to life. This book details Japan’s many exotic religions and varied forms of magic. New rules describe the means by which shokunin bring enchanted weapons to life, and the ways that wielders can tap into the full potential of those
weapons. Also within these pages you’ll find four new core classes for arcane and divine casters, a new magic system, many new feats, an even greater number of new spells, new priestly domains, and rules for magical weapons.

87593.name: Academy of Magic: Word Spells
87593.description:
Use your newfound powers and spells to become a Grand Master in this unique word game of magic and knowledge.

Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious! Advance from a lowly apprentice to a Grand Master of Magic by making the longest words on the board. Sound easy? Don’t be so sure!

Gain spells and use them wisely to combat the black magic tiles that aim to thwart your creations. Sharpen your vocabulary with three different modes of play. And if you feel brave enough, upload your score and see if you can make it on the top scores of the global leaderboard!

Source: The Developer Website.

87595.name: Rites of Battle
87595.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Rites of Battle, a supplement for Deathwatch, provides a host of additional options for players and GMs alike. This book expands on many of the ideas, themes, and systems present in the Deathwatch Rulebook and offers means to enrich and add detail to the adventures of a Kill- team in the Jericho Reach.

A host of new character options allow for increased personalization with thorough "Create Your Own Chapter" and "Alternate Specialities" rules. Plus, play a member of the Imperial Fists Chapter or one of the Successor Chapters that send Space Marines to the Deathwatch. Vehicle rules add a new dimension to gameplay and expand possibilities for adventure. Battle alien tanks with your Land Raider or prowl behind enemy lines with a Land Speeder Storm. Gain access to an extensive new armoury of weapons, armour, and relics from the armouries of Watch Fortress Erioch, or earn new special honours and distinctions to reflect your Space Marine’s glorious victories.

A valuable handbook for Space Marines of the Deathwatch, Rites of Battle contains everything needed to prepare a Deathwatch Kill-team for any mission.

87597.name: Zombie Driver
87597.description:
User Summary

In the aftermath of a zombie outbreak, you must drive through the hordes of undead to rescue survivors and take them back to the safety of the military base. Along the way, you should run over as many zombies as possible, and smash through various other destructible objects (cars, fences, benches) to gain points.
In story mode, you begin with a humble taxi, and as the game progresses you can upgrade your vehicle, unlock various weapons (machine guns, flamethrower, etc.), and unlock new types of vehicles with different strengths and weaknesses.
There is also Slaughter Mode, a survival mode where the goal is to stay alive as long as possible against increasing waves of zombies while grabbing upgrades for your vehicle and weapons.

87598.name: Purple Saturn Days
87598.description:
User Summary

Purple Saturn Days are a futuristic version of the Olympic games. Quoting for the game manual: "The PURPLE SATURN DAY Games are held every Saturn year. Eight species take part, including humans (that's you!). The eight competitors are divided into four pairs. The two individuals of each pair compete against one another in four competitions. The winners of these quarter-finals go on to the semi-finals and then to the final. The outright winner receives a kiss from the Purple Saturn Queen!"

There are four different sports in PSD:
- Ring Pursuit, a race in Saturn's asteroid rings. The player in the lead has to pass obstacles in a certain way (to the right of red obstacles, to the left of yellow ones) to score points.
- Tronic slider, in which contestant must shoot at energy balls and pick up the fragments, while navigating around a space platform.
- Brain Bowler, the puzzle part of the game, where the goal is to activate an android brain by guiding electric charges on a circuit to its memory banks. There are several components on the circuit that change the direction of electric charges, slow them or store them so a player can pick them up and drop them on another part of the circuit.
- Time Jump, a contest to see how far in time one can jump. There are three arcade phases in which the player must shoot stars in order to capture them to fuel the time catapult. Once the stars have been collected, the catapult is fired and the winner declared.

Aside from the championship mode, the game includes a training mode for each of the four competitions and a biography of each of the computer opponents, detailing their strengths and weaknesses.

As usual for an Exxos game, the game manual contained an extensive backstory and the "official participant's guide" (edited by the General Purple Saturn Day Committee), including recipes and prayers to Exxos for good luck.

87599.name: Bounty: Special Edition
87599.description:
Follow the clues to the treasure of a lifetime, in this unique twist of a match-3 & puzzle game!

Use your wits against the clock to solve 140 mind-boggling levels and gain riches untold! And if you are a landlubber, do not despair! The Relaxed, untimed mode is just for you! Or, if you feel particularly brave, see how long you can last in Eternity mode!

Collect and use power-ups, achieve well-timed combos, and uncover hidden levels! Unweave Mirabelle’s story by unlocking a wealth of hand-drawn comic pages

Source: The Developer Website.

87600.name: Fashion Boutique
87600.description:
Five unique stores and 50 frantic stages are yours to conquer in this Time Management game. Can you make the Top Sales?

Dress up your way in the world of fashion! Manage a series of fashion stores, and serve a wildly different and demanding bunch of quirky customers – ranging from expecting mothers to lost tourists!

Upgrade your shops with jazzy clothes collections, better cash machines, and even a water cooler!

Discover a story that changes depending on your character choices: Will you choose career, or personal life?

Source: The Developer Website.

87601.name: Legendary Tools: Nobility
87601.description:
From publisher blurb:
Legendary Tools: Nobility provides an alternative mechanic to alignment involving nobility points that track a character's behavior and a system of codes allowing individual players to emphasize their personal ethics.

This system was first seen in Legends of Excalibur: Arthurian Adventures, but is presented here as an add-on to traditional d20 fantasy classes.

This product also includes two new core classes (from LOE): the Knight and Noble along with a new Prestige Class version of the Paladin (most easily attained from the Knight core class).

87602.name: The Clockwork Man
87602.description:
Gather the parts to the world's greatest invention in this unique Steampunk, Hidden Object Adventure!

At the turn of the century, in an alternate timeline, steam-powered technology has become dominant in almost all walks of life. Join Miranda Calomy, and her robot, Sprocket, on a journey through this world of wondrous science!

Source: The Developer Website.

87603.description:
Escaping the T-Rex

From the back of thebox:
A hungry T-Rex tracked down a small Dromaesaurus and since he runs a lot faster then the small Dromaesaurus, they have to be more clever then him to escape. A cooperative game to train the concentration.

Each player gets a hand of cards.
Players add to the track if they have matching cards to move the Dromaesaurus, all matching cards in their hands are played on their turn adding cards to the track. If they don't have matching cards they can ask 1 other player if they have the other card of the pair.
The T-Rex is moved by rolling a 0-1-2 dice. Since the T-Rex starts on a T-Rex only part of the track he is a bit behind, but if he is lucky he can catch up on the Dromaesaurus and win the game. If the Dromaesaurus is not caught when all cards are played the game is won by the players.

Components:
12 T-Rex route cards
40 escape cards
2 playing pieces with stands
1 0-1-2 dice

The game is part of the T-RexWorld line of Die Spiegelburg.
87603.name: Flucht vor dem T-Rex

87604.name: Legends of Sorcery
87604.description:
From publisher blurb:
Welcome to Legends of Sorcery, the magical companion sourcebook to RPGObjects' Legends of Fantasy line of historical fantasy supplements. Past products in the Legends line have walked a fine line with magic, either incorporating a limited magical presence into the rules themselves (as was done in Legends of Excalibur: Arthurian Adventures) or publishing magic rules for each setting in a separate book for the Gamemaster to use or exclude as appropriate for his particular campaign (as was done in Legends of the Samurai). Legends of Sorcery takes the latter approach one step further, serving as the magic supplement for all future books in the Legends line. From this point forward, Legends books will be written as magic-free historical sourcebooks, providing historical information and combat classes. They will include guidelines for using Legends of Sorcery to add magic to the setting or time period (if desired).

What's different about Legends of Sorcery?
Legends of Sorcery is a skill-based magic system that abandons the spell slot system found in traditional fantasy d20 games derived from the SRD. It also abandons the spell point alternative used in past Legends books. Spells are cast with a skill check; the result of failing this check depends on the margin by which the skill check failed. Characters learn spells the same way that they cast them, except that learning a spell (adding it to the list of spells a character can use) is somewhat easier than casting that spell in the heat of battle. In addition to using a skill to represent spell casting, Legends of Sorcery also introduces the concept of the Base Magic Bonus. This represents the magical power inherent in the character's class, and serves as a modifier to any skill check the character makes to cast or learn a spell.

What's the same about Legends of Sorcery?
More than you might think. In this system, a character's spellcasting ability is limited by his skill and magical power, not by the number of times each day he can cast a given spell. However, Legends of Sorcery still uses spell levels, and all the spells in the PHB and other 3rd-party supplements will work under the rules presented here, should you wish to use them. This product changes the way spells are learned and cast, but does not alter the spells themselves.

Legends of Sorcery Includes:

A new skill based casting system.
11 spell casting core classes: Alchemist, Artificer, Elementalist, Hermit, Holy Man, Monk, Naturalist, Pagan Priest, Priest, Sage, Seer, Trickster.
New and modified metamagic feats.
New Spells.
New magic options.
Fate and Destiny system.

87605.name: The Clockwork Man 2
87605.description:
Embark on a steam-powered, rollercoaster journey through land, air, and water in this unique Hidden Object Adventure!

Miranda and Sprocket are back! Join them in their new adventures and discover the Hidden World, a land lost in time and glimpsed through legends.

Explore a Victorian era filled with wondrous contraptions and fascinating machinery.

Source: The Developer Website.

87606.name: AdventureQuest
87606.description:
User Summary

AdventureQuest a Flash-based Massively-Single-Player RPG by Artix Entertainment. The core game is free to play, though with a limitation ques on server access and a cap on class slikk access. Players who pay a one time membership fee gain unlimited access to areas and class skills.

The game updates every week and features regular events that often compile the participation of players to succeed, such as frequent war events.

Gameplay is turn based and is level grinding intensive. Combat takes place in a limited animation console style format while movemtny is via clicking on objects within the game to transfer between locations.

87607.name: Curse of the Moon
87607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Curse of the Moon is a d20 sourcebook about lycanthropes, with a particular focus on a simpler lycanthrope template (with a much smaller level adjustment) and ways of customizing a lycanthrope's abilities. Curse of the Moon provides options for lycanthropes and lycanthrope hunters, with new feats, spells, and magic items focused on the theme of lycanthropy. Rather than delving into specifics of lycanthrope culture, history, and religion, Curse of the Moon focuses on game mechanics, giving new options for this complex and often rules-troublesome group of creatures.

New lycanthrope templates including the simple lycanthrope, fey lycanthrope, and cursed lycanthrope
New feats including Celestial Lycanthrope, Lycanthrope Heir, and feats for animal movement, animal special abilities
New spells
New moon deities, including those from real-world mythology
Variant aversions and vulnerabilities to silver
Alternate alignments for lycanthropes
Effects of the Astral Plane on lycanthropy

87608.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In the early summer of 1898, the United States embarked on war with Spain. The Spanish actually declared war first, but no one doubted that the United States was the aggressor; whether said aggression was designed to acquire control over Cuba or liberate the island depended on one’s point of view. The small U.S. Regular Army would quickly be joined by tens of thousands of volunteers, who answered the war’s signature battle cry "Remember the Maine!" with the less-well-remembered response:

"To Hell with Spain!"

To Hell With Spain is a supplement for the Infantry Attacks series, based on the battles fought in Cuba and Puerto Rico between June and August 1898. It is not a complete game: ownership of any boxed game in the Infantry Attacks series is necessary to provide the rules and markers, and maps are drawn from the following Panzer Grenadier games and supplements: Elsenborn Ridge, Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Kokoda Trail, Eastern Front and 1940: The Fall of France. There are 10 scenarios, each based on an actual battle or situation from the Spanish-American War.

To Hell With Spain is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game’s components.
87608.name: Infantry Attacks: To Hell With Spain

87609.name: DragonFable
87609.description:
User Summary

DragonFable is Artix Entertainments second Massively-Single-Player RPG. DragonFable features a fully animated player that can move about the screen and travel from area to area instead of the static point and click of AdventureQuest.

Like AdventureQuest, the game is free to play and updated weekly with events, new items ot other advences. But without the server limitations. Players that upgrade gain access to more class skills and special side quests and equipment. Paying players also gain access to their dragon companion's juvenile and titan forms.

DragonFable differs from AdventureQuest also in that it tells an ongoing story that takes the player across the land. Player participation is again compiled to complet wars and other important events. The game retains the odd humor and parodies, though usually less off the wall than in its predecessor. Level grinding is still excessive though.

The game also features a new pseudo PVP arena where you may battle other players characters run by a battle AI.

87610.name: Arcane Archer
87610.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is the first in the series by Secular Games called Advanced Character Guides, a collection that takes a standard prestige class and brings new rules and concepts to improve your experience with it. Each of the SRD prestige classes will get its own volume, and we hope to offer new and exciting variants every time, toned accordingly to all of them.

Advanced Character Guide: Arcane Archer, will be your next step into this popular character option. With the rules presented in this PDF, it's possible to optimize the choices related to the class, and take it to a huge improvement in the long-time development. Inside, you'll find:

A 20-level arcane archer core class, if you want to play one from the very first level.
New feats that improve the arcane archer in what she excels.
Alternative arcane archers that best suit non-standard elf sub-races or character choices.
Sample arcane archers to be used as ready-to-play NPCs or inspiration for your own characters.
New spells and magic items for characters which take the bow as a favorite weapon.

87611.name: Ancient Warfare
87611.description:
Wargames Rules for Entire Battles. From Earliest History to 1400 AD.

A miniatures game for ancient and medieval warfare. The rules use interesting game mechanics, such as random movement rates, to represent the variable nature of warfare in the era it addresses.

Units are rated by a Unit Cohesion Value (UCV) that takes into account the armor, leadership, and training of the unit. For example, Roman legionaries would have a high UCV due to their better equipment, good leadership, and regular training while barbarian tribesmen would have a lower UCV.

Combat is divided into shooting, impact, and melee. Unit's abilities are divided into strengths and weaknesses in these areas. For example, a barbarian unit may have a high impact value, meaning that they have a formidable first charge, but their value in an ensuing melee is less imposing.

The figure scales used for the game is 1:50 (one model figure representing 50 actual men) and the time scale is one turn equals approximately 60 minutes. The game attempts to allow entire ancient battles to be fought out in miniature on the tabletop.

At the time it was published, Milgamex' "Ancient Warfare" emerged as a potential rival to the popularity of WRG's "Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles." However, they could not push WRG's rules out of the place they had gained in international competition play. The rules went through two printings, but by 1980, they were difficult to find in stores.

87612.name: Lines of Legend: Winter Elves
87612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Traveling through the Frozen Lands, only death and corruption await!

A complete description of the winter elves, and their role in the campaign.
Game stats for creation of a winter elf character.
The history of the Wayjik Clan and their descent into wickedness.
New feats and prestige classes for winter elves and characters of cold lands.
Sample encounters and adventure hooks featuring NPC winter elves.
New spells and magic items best suited for winter elf characters.




Although Lines of Legend: Winter Elves was mainly created to the Game Master, a player will also uncover interesting options inside it. If you like cold stuff, expect to find something of your taste inside, even if only a feat or prestige class. Lines of Legend: Winter Elves is presented in two formats (one landscape full-color and one B&W vertical printer-friendly), with cover and interior illustrations from the best artists brought to you by Secular Games.

87613.name: MechQuest
87613.description:
User Summary

MechQuest is Artix Entertainments 3rd Massively-Single-Player RPG. This time following a Mecha theme with the player piloting various customizable giant robots.

The game used the same engine as DragonFable, allowing the player the ability to move around and interact with the environments both in the mech and on foot where allowed. It follows also the AE format of being free to play, while paying players gain access to better equipment and their own starship. Player participation is compiled here as well for wars, either against NPC threats or even rival classes at the mecha university.

87614.name: Shadows of Shinobi
87614.description:
From Introduction:

Masters of disguise that slay their victims with bluffing, hidden weapons, poisons, and cunning… Invisible demons able to trespass castle walls and the sharpest sentinels as if they didn’t even exist, they are fearsome warriors with a vast array of mystical skills. That is all the knowledge common folk living in feudal Japan had about the spies, saboteurs and murderers known as shinobi – the Ninja.

In the real world, they are the stuff from legends. In Fantasy RPG, though, we may be able to find out the awful truth – all that was said above is real! In our imagination, those mysterious mercenaries always possessed too many abilities to fit in just one model, so we decided to present, in this book, five different prestige classes that emulate various characterizations of the Ninja, each with its own focus and style, besides new feats, spells, magic items and equipment.

You, as a Player or Game Master, can choose which one fits better in your campaign, or even use all of them. Although being typical figures in oriental cultures, any world where we could find enough war, conspiracy, spying and sabotage would have room for these masters of the night.

87615.name: East Front Campaign CD 1: Winter War Expansion Pack
87615.description:
User Summary:

An expansion for East Front, containing six new nationalities (Poland, Hungary, Finland, Slovakia, Italy and Romania), 7 new campaigns and 50 new scenarios.

87616.name: AdventureQuest Worlds
87616.description:
User Summary

AdventureQuest Worlds, more commonly referred to by the staff as AQ Worlds, is Artix Entertainments first true MMO RPG. The game features full player interaction with other players and the gameplay is geared such that players must co-operate to defeat bosses.

Gameplay is diffrent from previous AE releases in some ways, though class skills are costume dependant. AQ Worlds though removes the problem of "cookie cutter" players all wearing the same best gear by making the equipment system based soley on what upgrades you apply. Any weapon of the same basic upgrade level will do the same damage range. This allows a player to outfit their character based on looks rather than what is perceived "best".

Levelling though is divided into two linked groups. The characters level, which determines what upgrades can be accessed, and any class they are wearing's level. A player must wear and gain EXP with a class to level it up seperately from any other classes they might have on hand.

As with all other AE games, it is free to play. But this time paying players must pay a monthly, quarterly or yearly fee to access better upgrades, special costumes, parts of quests and certain shops. Players lose access to any equipment that required a paying account that has lapsed.

87617.name: West Front Battle Pack 1
87617.description:
User Summary:

An expansion for West Front, including 50 new scenarios, new troop types and a campaign option.

87619.name: Boot Camp Academy
87619.description:
Boot Camp Academy is a party game that enables casual gamers to experience the Army as a new recruit. Players can learn how to drive a tank, spy on their enemies, protect the Earth from space invaders, as well as peeling potatoes and doing push-ups!

Source: The Publisher Website.

87620.name: Advanced Player's Guide
87620.description:
From the back of the book:

"Take your game to a new level. The Advanced Player's Guide is a companion volume to the Player's Handbook and other d20 core rulebooks which provides a wealth of new rules options for players and Game Masters. New and expanded classes, new skills, new combat systems, new magic systems and more - all the tools you need to supercharge your campaign!"

87621.name: Sportz Dice: Baseball
87621.description: A dice game simulating the game of Baseball by using two dice. One die is the "Pitching" die, which has STRIKES, BALLS and HITS. The second die or "Batting" die (used when a HIT is rolled on the "Pitching" die) has FOUL, CAUGHT and HOMERUN on its faces.

87622.name: The Dungeoneer (Issue 19, Sep - Oct 1980)/The Judges Guild Journal (Issue 22, Aug - Sep 1980)
87622.description:
The Dungeoneer/The Judges Guild Journal
Issue #19/Issue #22
September/October 1980/August/September 1980

The Dungeoneer #19 and The Judges Guild Journal #22 issued as one magazine.

Cover art by Paul Jaquays.

87624.name: Stunt Copter
87624.description:
Stunt Copter is a classic Macintosh game which involved piloting a small helicopter around a playfield and clicking at the right time so that a person suspended from the aircraft would fall into a hay bale on a moving cart. Unless precisely timed, the person might fall onto the ground or injure the horse or the driver of the cart.

The game was developed by Duane Blehm whose other games included Cairo Shootout and ZeroGravity. His small software company was known as HomeTown Software. After his death, his parents released his games and source code into the public domain.

A Mac OS X version of the game has been released by Antell Software.

An iPhone/iPod Touch version of the game was released by nerdgames in 2009. It is available at the iTunes Store.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stunt Copter," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87626.name: Polaritease
87626.description:
From the back of the box:
Polaritease is the unique vertical board game that has caught the attention of people around the world. By using the forces of magnetism, each player is presented with the opportunity to create a wide variety of game-winning strategies.

Polaritease comes complete with rules, a black and white set of positive and negative charged tokens, a triangular game board, and two stands for mounting in a vertical position.

From the rules:
The object of Polaritease is simple. If you remove your tokens from the board before your opponent, you win. This is done when each token is placed on the bottom row, advanced to the red holes and then removed.

87627.description:
It is mid-19th century Mexico. As more and more railroad companies emerge in the US, the transportation of goods is at an all-time high. trading between countries is booming, and Mexico is ready to develop its rail system for transportation of goods to the USA.

Can you be the first to build the best rail system south of the border and control the Railways of Mexico?

Components:
Mexico gameboard
Railroad Baron and Railroad Operation cards for the Mexico map
Rules
Scoreboard

This expansion will be included in the revised edition of the Railways of the World base game (scheduled for release at the end of 2010), but will also be available separately as a self-contained expansion for owners of Railroad Tycoon and of the first edition of Railways of the World.
87627.name: Railways of Mexico

87628.name: Prodigy GC
87628.description:
"What is this? A prodigy? A collective hallucination? This is not a movie. This is not a child’s play. This is not even the real world, as you’ve known it until now, at least...This is more".

For fifteen years players had to customize their own deck: now, at last, they can customize their cards too!

Prodigy Game Cards is a card game, you don't collect it, proper for experienced players; every player drives a group of people "special" in it: these people are called WIPper, in specific places around the world, that in order to prevail on the adversaries fight for many purposes.

These characters, at first sight, seem just common people, but possess increased ability that we called "prodigies." It is a WIPper who succeeds in these "prodigies". Who is not able to do it, is without bond. Four types of bond exist and each is represented, in the game, by a different color:

Molecular - yellow: those people that can modify their phisical structure and their molecular density in different ways.
Elementary - green: they possess the ability to channel, to send forth and to check different types of energy using the body as catalyst.
Feral - red: they possess a combination of Dna human and animal, that allow them to possess animal physical powers.
Psionic - blue: they are the WIPpers that possess some superior mental abilities.

To play a game of Prodigy Game Cards it needs at least two players. Every player must possess WIPper (the protagonists of our history), Places (where they fight) and a deck of Prodigies (the special actions that are able to do).

With Prodigy Game Cards you can directly reach a new level of personalization: the Prodigies have the technology Scracth&Play, developed in collaboration with Cartamundi, that allows the players to personalize, in phase of construction of the deck, every single paper.

Every Prodigy possesses three levels of power: low, middle and high.
According to the strategy and experience, and according to the objective that the player want to get during the game, he decides what value "to release." To increase a low value, is necessary to remove the patina that covers the left yellow panel of the paper; to increase the value, without going to far, it is recommended the panel (orange) found to the center; if you need values of maximum power, it needs to set the right the panel (red) free.

87629.name: Match!: hvordan ser du din verden?
87629.description:
The game is so far only in danish...
But the rules are simple:

In the game Match! you have to explain why pictures are alike. You have to convince the other players, that your match is the best, but thats not enough. You also have to appreciate another players good explanation!

Yo get point for best match (most votes) and for appreciating the best match. The first player woth 20 points is the winner.

In Danish:

Match! - hvordan ser du din verden?
I match! skal du forklare, hvordan billeder af verden hænger sammen. Det kræver hverken terninger eller paratviden, det handler om at fortælle de gode historier - og at værdsætte de andres!

Reglerne kort fortalt:
Hver spiller får tre billeder på hånden. På bordet lægges et tilfældigt billeder, det er dette billede, de skal forsøge at 'matche'.
I hver runde vælger spillerne det billedkort fra hånden, som han/hun synes passer bedst med det kort, der i forvejen ligger på bordet. Spilleren forklarer eller fortæller en historie om hvorfor netop dette kort passer bedst – altså er det bedste Match! Alt gælder, så det gælder bare om at lade fantasien løbe.

Når alle spillere har lagt deres billedkort ned og fortalt deres historie, er det tid til afstemningen. Her stemmes der om hvem der har fortalt den bedste historie. Det er tilladt at stemme på sig selv.

Den spiller der har fået flest stemmer og dermed fortalt den bedste historie får 1 point. Alle de spillere, der har stemt på den spiller der fik flest stemmer, får hver 3 point. Det gælder altså ikke kun om at kunne fortælle den bedste historie, men også om at kunne anerkende en god historie fortalt af en anden...

Når der er fundet en afgørelse, lægges det vindende billedkort på bordet, ved siden af det kort der lige er fundet match til. Dette er nu det nye kort, der skal matches. Efterhånden i spillet kommer der altså en længere sammenhæng af billeder, tænk lige over det!

Spillerne får nye billeder i stedet for de brugtem og en ny runde starter.

Specialrunder. Hver spiller har desuden et 'specialrundekort', som kan ændre rundens form, når det spilles. F.eks. at der denne runde ikke må siges noget...

Pointene er ringe, der sættes på hver spillers pointtårn. Når en spiller har tårnet fyldt op, har han/hun vundet. Tillykke!

Source: summary from the rules + papskubber.dk

87630.name: A Lump of Coal
87630.description:
A traditional holiday threat by both exasperated parents and sly Secret Santas, A Lump of Coal is what you'll find in your stocking if you weren't a good little boy this year. Or girl. Or even goblin.

Typically found as a roughly fist-sized lump, A Lump of Coal is similar to the somewhat more polyhedral popular dice used in many RPGs, except that it doesn't matter which side winds up on top when you roll it. But hey, you can always use it for heating.

A Lump of Coal can be found in versions ranging from matte black to dull gray.

Naughty, naughty.

87632.description:
You are a survivor of a zombie apocalypse and you're stuck in a house with a broken car and hordes of zombies are attacking in the lawn. But wait, you found tools enough to fix the car to escape from the hordes of zombies. ARE YOU READY FOR IT?

Escape of the Dead is a solo game. In the game you are trying to fix the car while trying to defend yourself against hordes of zombies. You're given 4 Action dice per turn, distribute between 3 sections of the game (either by shooting zombie, fixing the barricade and/or fixing the car). Roll for success on each section. Any zombie that survived will attack the barricade. When you successfully killed 10 zombies you will be rewarded with power-up. You lose when your barricade is down (i.e barricade's hp equals zero). You win when the car is fixed 100% and get out of the house.

All you need to play

1 A4 paper to print the board + rule
4 six sided dice
a pencil (optional)
an eraser (optional)




As of 1.5 (The 'portable edition'), all you need to play

1 A4/Letter paper to print the rules
1 A4/Letter cardstock to print the cards/zombies
4 six sided dice
4 transparent card sleeves (optional)
1 Dry Erase Marker/Grease Pencil (optional)
Something to erase markings (optional)
Gaming Stones (or some other marker) instead of Dry Erase/Grease Pencil. The amount you use is by preference. You will need from 3-30. 12 is ideal (1 for a zombie kill track, 1 for repair track, and 10 for barricade HP - You could make the barricade damage a track and only require 3 markers).




You can download the game for FREE in the file/download section below.

You can also visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/
87632.name: Escape of the Dead Minigame

87633.name: Bombs Away
87633.description:
Bombs Away is a simple game of magnetic planes that drop ball bearing bombs on targets.

The aim of the game is to pick up metal ball bearings from the side of the board with your "magnet" plane, then try to fly the plane across the plastic covering — with the plane on top of the plastic and the ball hanging below it — and aim to drop the bomb onto one of the targets below. Each target gives a different score, and the player with the highest score wins.

87634.name: Terror War
87634.description:
Terror War is a DTP solitaire, strategy level game of the current conflict against al Qaeda and various potential adversaries. The player takes the side of the U.S./West and must choose one of the offered strategies. Operations include military, diplomatic, and intelligence. Economics have been added and interleaved as an important factor.

Initial strategy in the Historic game is set and one must follow through with it until allowed to change strategy. This presents both opportunity and difficulty. Terror operations are governed by Random Event and various rules. While the terror side may not seem too active, it's very existence constitutes a tremendous threat to the U.S./Western position in the world. Players will feel the pressure and frustration of achieving the right balance of strategy to means. A half dozen or so different strategies are available to play with.

The game spans 20 one-year turns, from 2001 to 2021. By the end of this time the U.S. side must either bring off a victory, or lose.

This is a tough, strange war and the game reflects that reality.

Download rules, map, counters, etc at http://talk.consimworld.com/WebX?14@153.EuETbiw6OXw.45@.1dd4...

87635.name: Quiz Spiel
87635.description: Players have to answer trivia questions of different categories. A pawn moving around on a board shows which category. The first player to answer 10 questions correct wins the game.

87637.name: Wunderwerk Online (Issue 7 - Nov 2010)
87637.description:
Table of Content:

Editorial
Der Flug des schwarzen Schmetterlings - DSA scenario
Dungeonslayers - system review
Lieferung nach BP-5 - Space Gothic scenario
Grab in die Vergangenheit - Hollow Earth scenario
Der kleine Dämonenbeschwörer - DSA comic

87638.name: Cthuloide Welten (Issue 19 - Oct 2010)
87638.description:
Contents:

Editorial
News
MorgenGrauen - scenario
Der tiefe Fall des Dr. Erben - scenario
Die versunkene Stadt - scenario
Tunguska - background
Harry Price - Geisterjäger - background
August Derleth - essay on the author
Der unheilige Windhund - story for Cthulhu middleages
Janyce und Charles Engan - interview with the authors of Beyond the Mountains of Madness
Magische Kräfte und monströse Kreaturen - GM tips
Unspeakable Vault of Doom - comic

87639.description:
This special item was available at the SPIEL10 fair in Essen together with the game.

Tréville is the captain of the Musketeers.

His is an charismatic leader with the following special ability:

Once per turn during the Musketeers’ phase, when it is Tréville’s turn to play, he may give any of the Musketeers one ‘order’. This costs Tréville 1 action. The Musketeer carries out this free action at once according to normal rules (i.e. draw a card, move, fight, etc.).
87639.name: Mousquetaires du Roy: Tréville miniature

87640.name: Rage: Mutant Bash TV
87640.description:
RAGE comes to your mobile device with the hit of the wastelands, Mutant Bash TV! This intense first-person shooter casts you in the starring role of a post-apocalyptic game show where you’ll be stalked by hungry mutants while you scour pulse-pounding levels for ammo and cash pick-ups. Make a deal with J.K Stiles, the show’s menacing host, and see if you have what it takes to survive this carnage-filled carnival of death!

Source: The Game Website.

87641.description:
At the Essen Toy Fair 2010, Lookout Games has published a new special card for Le Havre.
It is part of the Lookout Games anniversary catalog and has to be cut out.

This card is included in the 2017 edition of Le Havre.

The new card has the following ability:

"Nimm Dir 1 Schuldschein und 6 unterschiedliche Waren Deiner Wahl (außer Stahl)."

In English:

"Take 1 loan and 6 different goods (except Steel)."

You can find an English version of this card in the files section.
87641.name: Le Havre: Spielemesse Sonderkarte

87642.name: Mushihimesama Bug Panic
87642.description:
A bomb-throwing bug-busting action game based on the legendary arcade shooter series "Mushihimesama"!

A mysterious voice, and a mysterious girl..what's going on in Shinju Forest?? Reco's adventure begins now!

Use three different types of seed bombs to bring peace back to the insect kingdom!

Source: The Game Website.

87643.name: The Lord of the Rings: Middle-earth Defense
87643.description:
User Summary

A tower defense game set in Middle Earth.

87644.name: Dodonpachi Resurrection
87644.description:
User Summary

A massive shoot-em-up from Cave.

87645.name: Espgaluda II
87645.description:
Espgaluda II (エスプガルーダII) is a manic shooter by Cave, sequel to Espgaluda. An Xbox 360 release, titled Espgaluda II Black Label, was released on February 25, 2010 in Japan.

The game takes place in a fictional land called Soma, three years after a massive war known as the Great Shinra War devastated the land and killed most of its plantlife. Humanity is forced to pull their efforts together for the sake of survival and reforestation.

Using new found technology, an alchemist named Hiodoshi spearheaded a project called Project Espgaluda, which gathered youths and used them as experimental test subjects for artificial armored wings. They were then called Galuda, named after the mythical bird of legend.

Ageha and Tateha were two of the subjects who escaped during the project. At the end of Espgaluda, they were reunited with their mother and lived peacefully after going into hiding. Espgaluda II begins when they are discovered.

Source: Wikipedia, "Espgaluda II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The standard edition of the game is region free and can be played on any Xbox 360 console, the special edition is locked to Japan and would need a Japanese 360 in order to run.

87647.name: Galactic Assault: Prisoner of Power
87647.description:
The story in this turn-based strategy game based on novel "Prisoners of Power" by Strugatsky brothers unfolds, after Maxim destroyed the Center (Central Broadcast Station) and the Land of Fathers army was defeated in the North. Khonties, Barbarians and the Island Empire, being all unyielding enemies, will get involved in fierce warfare set to destroy the entire race of the Land of Fathers.

Each race will possess and develop easily distinguishable technologies. Therefore, heavy armored, transport, and aviation units, each of absolutely different construction will be present on the battlefield. The battles will take place among 3D vivid extraterrestrial landscapes, with day and night change and dynamic weather conditions that will affect the gameplay. A haze of exhausted gases poise over steel battle machines; the ground gets blasted by tracks of tanks and other heavy vehicles; artillery fire scratches, burns and breaches heavily armored units.

Game features include:
- Immersive storyline based on "Prisoners of Power" by the Strugatsky brothers.
- 4 totally unique races: Land of the Fathers, Khonties, Barbarians and Island Empire.
- Realistic battle system (camouflage, fog of war, return fire, mine laying, fortifications, land and air troop carriers).
- Advanced technology tree and unit upgrade system.
- Realistic full 3D environment with day/night change and weather effects.
- Cinematic Camera mode showing the most dramatic moments.

Source: The Developer Website.

87648.name: Pirate Brothers
87648.description:
From the rules:

In the mid 18th century, two fearless pirate brothers ruled the seas of the world as it was then known. They were Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair.
They salvaged treasures, attacked merchant ships and embarked on many an adventure. Over the years, the par assembled loyal crews and had magic pirate spells which they used to spread terror and fear throughout the civilised world. They were as thick as thieves. As for who was the strongest of the two, no one knew. To decide those once and for all, each pirate kidnapped the beloved lady of the other.
In this exciting duel between two legendary figures, the players take on the roles of Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair and each attempt to free their ladies from the clutches of their brother.
The table where the cards are laid represents the sea and its islands. The hand of each player represents their pirate ship, while the cards symbolise the crew or the pirate spells. Which pirate brother will be the first to free his lady from the grasp of his brother?

Object of the game:
The object of the game is to free your pirate lady from the clutches of your opponent pirate.
The first player whose lady (Lady in Red for the Red Corsair, Lady in Black for Captain Blackbeard) appears on the opponent's discard pile is the winner.
Cards land on the discard pile either by defeating them while fighting on an isle or due to a penalty when the opponent pirates controle one or more of the 4 islands. Care has to be taken on which island your followers should be send as even the strongest pirate has its weaknesses. Furthermore, every island has its own penalties (e.g. discard cards from your hand / discard pile or pirates already on islands) which should be considered.

87649.name: Bedmaster
87649.description: This is an adult themed game in which the goal is to use cards and directions in race to disrobe your "opponent." Each turn the two players are vying to control the title "Bedmaster," which gives them control of that round.

87650.name: 50 New Ways to Blow Things Up
87650.description:
From Introduction:

Greetings and thank you for purchasing Fifty New Ways To Blow Things Up: Starlanko the Magnificent’s Book of Evocations. I, as you may have guessed, am Starlanko the Magnificent. This book is sort of a culmination point for me. After years of selling spells on a one-to-one basis, I am finally able to reach the broad market I had always hoped to and bring you the greatest spell-related tome ever written!

Instrumental to this tome is a new technique of spell scribing developed after years of research that allows you to prepare spells directly from this book, even if you have never seen the spell before in your life.

If all goes according to plan, this spellbook will be the first in a series of Fifty New Ways to... spellbooks. Each will focus on a different school of magic, each one as good, if not better, than the one you hold in your hands. If you enjoy this book or find it useful, please be on the lookout for further volumes. Feel free to scribe me a letter or contact me via sending as I’m always eager to hear the opinions of my fans. Or better yet, tell let all of your friends about the book; word of mouth is the greatest form of advertising.

87652.name: Neo Contra
87652.description:
Neo Contra takes place during A.D. 4444 when the Earth has been transformed into a prison planet, home to criminals and political rebels (contras). From this underworld society rises a new order called "Neo Contra". This government quickly showed its true colors, as it has other plans than bringing back normal civilization. Carrying out this new threat are four renegade contra, who are called the Four Elite. Thus, Bill Rizer is partnered with Genbei "Jaguar" Yagyu, a samurai, and the two are sent to Earth to deal with the Neo Contra threat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Neo Contra", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87653.name: The Island Laboratory
87653.description:
From Introduction:

This product contains four sets of maps—a map of the island itself; a map of the natural cave with a secret passage to the first level of the base; a map of the first level of the base (also accessible by swimming through a tunnel in the cove); and a map of the second level of the base. The four maps can be used in isolation or as a set. Within each set includes full color maps with and without labels and printer-friendly black and white maps with and without labels.

87654.name: The Spider Lair
87654.description:
From Introduction:

This product contains a map for a spider cult lair of two types--a map for the lair of a humanoid cult who worships spiders and a web-filled map of the same lair infested with spiders (most likely intelligent ones). Each type includes a labeled color map with grids, an unlabeled color map, black and white labeled and unlabeled maps for home printing.

87656.name: Aliens versus Predator 2

videogamehonor.29712: 2002 D.I.C.E. Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)

87656.description:
Like its predecessor, Aliens versus Predator 2 allows the player to choose one of three characters: an Alien, Predator or human Colonial Marine. Each character has different objectives, abilities and weapons at their disposal. The single-player campaigns present the player with conventional series of levels that are designed around the abilities of each character.
As the Colonial Marine, the player uses a number of weapons to combat Aliens and Predators. The Marine wears armor for protection, and uses an image intensifier, flashlight and flares to improve visibility in dark areas.
When playing as the Predator, the player uses a variety of weapons from the Predator films such as wrist blades, a throwing disc, and shoulder-mounted energy weapons. The Predator is more durable than the human or the Alien and can survive falls from greater heights than the human. It can use a cloaking device to become invisible and several different modes of vision to help in the detection of enemies, including infrared vision and a mode sensitive to electrical systems. Unlike in the previous game, the Predator in Aliens versus Predator 2 recharges its energy supply using a personal item.
As an Alien the player can explore most of the game's environments freely, even climbing across walls and ceilings. However, the Alien has no weapons and must use its claws, tail, and jaws to attack enemies. The player can also use a form of echolocation in dark areas and can detect pheromones to discern human or Predator enemies. The Alien can drop from any height without injury and is the fastest of the three player characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aliens versus Predator 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87657.name: Władcy losu
87657.description:
From the back of the cover:

"Władcy losu" to hybryda gry RPG i gry strategicznej. Pozwala bawić się postaciami o potężnych, paranormalnych zdolnościach, a jednocześnie jest emocjonująca jak "gra na giełdzie". Wymaga od grających nieustannego obmyślania nowych, wyrafinowanych strategii.

Fundamentem systemu jest teoria mówiąca, że nad losem ludzi czuwają Tkacze, którzy w chwilach kluczowych przejmują na siebie odpowiedzialność za nakłanianie ich do Dobrego i Złego. Tkacze reprezentują przeciwstawne sobie siły: Dobro i Zło, albo Jasność i Ciemność - jakkolwiek by je nazwano. Gracze wcielają się w Tkaczy i obejmują "opiekę" nad pojedyńczym człowiekiem. Są Wysłannikami Przeznaczenia i tworzą dwa przeciwstawne obozy, grające przeciw sobie. Nierzadko od tego, kto wygra, zależą dalsze losy całego świata.

Tkacze posiadają specyficzne cechy i oryginalne moce. Jest to system, w którym zamiast typowych cech (siła, zręczność itp.) mamy asystę (moc wpływania na podopiecznego), wpływy (oddziaływanie na otoczenie), tworzenie (manipulowanie czasoprzestrzenią), siłę awatara (pozwalającą manifestować się w Świecie Śmiertelnych) i Moc. Dzięki szerokiemu wachlarzowi inspirujących zdolności, gracze automatycznie wpadają na zaskakujące, błyskotliwe rozwiązania, co daje wiele satysfakcji.

We "Władców losu" możemy grać w dowolnym okresie historii świata (np. starożytny Rzym, Rewolucja Październikowa, podbój kosmosu) lub nawet w innych, fantastycznych uniwersach (jako nakładka na inne gry RPG).

Autor gry, Krzysztof Piskorski, to zdobywca Quentina w 2001 r. za najlepszy scenariusz.

and translation:

"Władcy losu" (eng. "The Lords of Fate") is a hybrid of RPG and strategy game. It allows you to play characters with powerful psychic abilities, and yet it is as exciting to as "stock market." It requires from players to constantly devise new and sophisticated strategies and gameplans.

The foundation system is a theory which says that the fate of people ensured by the Weavers, who in moments of crucial importance assume the responsibility for forcing them to do Good or Evil. Weavers represent opposing forces: Good and Evil, or the Brightness and Darkness - however you call them. Players take the Weavers and include "protection" of a single human being. They are envoys of Destiny, and form two opposing camps, playing against each other. Quite often on who will win, depends on the fate of the world.

Weavers have special features and unique powers. It is a system where instead of the typical characteristics (strength, dexterity, etc.) there are: assistance (power to affect the ward), influence (impact on the environment), creation (manipulate time and space), power of an avatar (allowing manifest themselves in the mortal world), and force (not to be confused with force of the jedi, though) . With the wide range of inspirational abilities, players will automatically come up with surprising, clever solutions, which gives much satisfaction.

In "Władcy losy," we can play at any time in the history of the world (i.e. ancient Rome, the October Revolution, the conquest of space) or even in other fantastic worlds (as a wrapper for other RPGs).

The author of the game is Krzysztof Piskorski, a winner of Quentin (note: this is polish annual award for best RPG scenarios) in 2001.

87658.description:
It's the ultimate book of spells . . . the Munchkinomicon. But beware! If you aren't munchkinly enough, the Munchkinomicon will slip away and find a more suitable host. This set includes the Munchkinomicon and 14 of its deviously cheesy spells, like United I Stand, Eldritch Cleaver, and Unnatural Compulsion.

This is an expansion for ANY Munchkin game. It is not a stand-alone game. This is NOT a collectible or randomized set. Every Munchkinomicon pack is the same as every other.

Part of the Munchkin series
87658.name: Munchkinomicon

87659.name: The Sky Crawlers: Innocent Aces
87659.description:
The Sky Crawlers: Innocent Aces is an arcade-style combat flight simulator for the Wii based on the 2008 anime film adaptation of Hiroshi Mori’s novel series The Sky Crawlers. Developed by Namco Ltd.’s Ace Combat development team Project Aces, the game was released in Japan by Namco Bandai Games Inc. on October 16, 2008. XSEED Games released the game in North America on January 12, 2010.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Sky Crawlers: Innocent Aces", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87660.name: Zasłonka gracza
87660.description:
User Summary:

This is a humorous product.

It's basically three things in one:

Player's screen which allows player to hide and not be seen by Dungeon Master (with slogans like "Dodge!!" and "Detect Magic!" written on it)
Hyper-big character sheet - like small copybook but for *1* character only
Player's cheat sheet - with most important rules of d20




While it's general product, it is indirectly dedicated for fantasy settings.

87661.name: West Front: Operation Sea Lion
87661.description:
User Summary:

West Front: Operation Sea Lion is an expansion to Talonsoft's West Front game, concentrating on Germany's planned invasion of England during WW2 and featuring 30 new scenarios and 3 campaigns.

87662.name: Fall of the Reich
87662.description:
User Summary:

Talonsoft's Fall of the Reich is an expansion to their East Front II game and includes 17 new scenarios, 3 new campaigns, as well as a number of game enhancements.

87663.name: Europe in Flames
87663.description:
User Summary:

Europe in Flames is a compilation of four previous titles in Talonsoft's Campaign Series:

1) West Front
2) West Front Battle Pack 1
3) West Front: Operation Sea Lion
4) East Front II

(It should be noted that East Front II is itself a compilation of East Front and East Front Campaign CD 1: Winter War Expansion Pack.)

87664.description:
From the R&R Games Website:

200 all new categories in this expansion set to Smarty Party. Fans of this game have patiently waited while we handpicked each category and carefully ripened them until they were practically bursting with flavor. Now that long wait is finally over and they're ready for play!
87664.name: Smarty Party! Expansion Set 2

87665.name: Fantazyn (Issue 6 - Sep 2006)
87665.description:
Normal, mixed RPG stuff for D&D, WFRP2, Neuroshima and World of Darkness.

Table of contents: (in polish and english):

(note - original table of contents used bold fonts and and different font sizes to achieve what I represented with numbers)
(polish - english)
1. Sekcja: fantastyka (eng. Section: speculative fiction)
1.1. Podsekcja: opowiadania (eng. Subsection: short stories)
1.1.1 Upadek władcy (eng. Ruler's Fall)
1.1.2 Eternix
1.1.3 Deus ex Cubus
1.1.4 Czarna rada (eng. Black Council)
1.2. Podsekcja: feletiony (eng. Subsection: feuilletons)
1.2.1. Dlaczego fantastyka? (eng. Why speculative fiction)
1.2.2. Patrzę i płączę (eng. I'm watching and crying)
2. Sekcja: Gry fabularne (Section: role-playing games)
2.1. Dungeons & Dragons
2.1.1. Dzwon, który wezwał przeklętych (eng. A Bell which summoned the cursed)
2.1.1.1. Postacie (eng. Characters)
2.1.1.2. karty żeglarskie (eng. Sailing charts)
2.1.2. Collegium Magicum
2.1.3. Blask Waterdeep (eng. Glow of Waterdeep)
2.2. Warhammer
2.2.1. Fimir
2.2.2. Jednooki interes (eng. One-eyed business)
2.2.2.1. Postacie (eng. Characters)
2.2.3. Haj Fantazy! (eng. Ay, Fantasy!)
2.2.4. Nowa, Dawna Wiara (eng. New Old Faith)
2.3. WoD
2.3.1. Wampir, Confessia (eng. Vampire, Confessia)
2.4. Neuroshima
2.4.1. Postapokaliptyczne sporty (eng. Postapocalyptic sports)
2.5. Systemy autorskie (eng. I have no idea how they are called in english speaking countries; it's something between: "Indie RPG" and "Home-designed RPG")
2.5.1. Shadowkeep

87666.name: Zły Cień. Kruki Urojenia.
87666.description:
This was the first polish RPG ever published.

From the back of the cover:

"Zły Cień to fantastyczna gra fabularna, której akcja toczy się w czasach Wczesnośredniowiecznej Polski lub w fantastycznej krainie Ardalonne.

Gra toczy się w wyobraźni graczy.

Mistrz gry - jeden z nich - tworzy scenariusz przygody w jaką pragnie wciągnąć pozostałych.

Oni kreują bohaterów (wojów, czarowników etc.) i starają się wczuć w wyimaginowaną psychikę swych postaci i czarodziejski świat gry.

Każdy z herosów ma dokładnie określone cechy, a czynnik losowy ustalany jest przez rzut kostkami sześciościennymi i porównywany z wartością atrybutów postaci (siła, sprawność, intelekt itd...).

Głównym założeniem systemu jest maksymalne wcielenie gracza w odgrywaniu postaci."

and translation:

"Zły Cień" (eng. "Evil Shadow") is a fantasy role-playing game, in which the action takes place in early medieval Poland or in the fantastic land of Ardalonne.

The game takes place in the imagination of players.

Game Master - one of them - creates a scenario in which there is an adventure for players.

They create characters (warriors, wizards, etc.) and try to empathize with the psyche of his imaginary characters and magical world of the game.

Each of the heroes has a clearly defined features and a random factor is determined by rolling d6s and comparing with the value attribute of the trait (strength, agility, intellect, etc. ..).

The main goal is to feel as created persona as much as possible."

87667.name: Wobbly Chef Junior
87667.description:
This is a dexterity game where players have to try and balance food items on the two trays held by a waiter. What makes this a game is that the waiter's feet are not flat, they're rounded, so any addtion to the trays causes the whole mass to move about.

The loser is the person who causes the food to fall off the trays.

87670.name: The Dungeoneers Journal (Issue 24 - Dec 1980/Jan 1981)
87670.description:
The Dungeoneers Journal
Issue #24
December 1980/January 1981

Cover art by Kevin Siembieda.

87671.name: AZINCOURT
87671.description:
Several versions of the battle have been produced. Each has been contrived to show a historic resolution, fun for the English player, depressing for the French. Azincourt (French spelling) is a unique approach. The French might have had more coordinated leadership. They might not have been so intent on an easy victory, and as a result been so careless. They might have taken advantage of the vulnerable English advance. They might have waited for the English to wear themselves out crossing the muddy field and allowed Henry to make the first attack. They might have employed their crossbows to better effect. Had they better control of their troops, crowded conditions would not have reduced combat effectiveness. Finally, had they considered avenues for retreating units, disruption of fresh units would not been such a problem.

In Azincourt I address a number of these what-ifs but, moreover, I offer players the unique mechanic of commanding one flank of each opposing army. In effect players play BOTH the French AND the British. It works out much better than you would expect. Since the English line is necessarily pretty static, there is little problem in coordinating an English defense while splitting command of the French in the face of the enemy mirrors the historically poor French command.

Azincourt is a card assisted, counter and hex game utilizing large colorful counters and a variety of aids that allows for a key battle component which other versions neglect to emphasize - the capture of nobles for ransom. Integral to Azincourt play is the capture of these nobles, English and French (including King Henry), of varying value. Ah and then there are the complications that such nobles bring. Wounded nobles become easy targets. Captured nobles make targets of their captors. Then there are Henry's terrible archers ... who WILL run out of arrows, and then what? To add to the game's variety is a random set-up and reinforcemnt schedule that toys with a number of possible historical possibilities.

Playtesting has been a blast so far but continues so no publisher has yet committed. Still, all in good time...

87673.name: The Dungeoneers Journal (Issue 25 Feb / Mar 1981)

rpgissuearticle.144886: Academy of Adventure Gaming Arts & Design

87673.description:
From Table of Contents:

Features:
Laboratory
Sea Devils: A fantasy story about Sahuagin by Bill Daley
