George is held at New York, Lizzie is imprisoned in Tokyo, and Ralph is stored in London (references to King Kong, Godzilla, and The Werewolf of London, respectively). Scumlabs, who has just rebuilt their facilities in Salt Lake City, causes another accident that results in three new monsters: Curtis, a mouse, Boris, a rhinoceros, and Ruby, a lobster. Players choose one of the three original monsters to rescue. The player then uses the characters in the part of the world where the rescue is held. They work as a collective to break buildings, eat people, and destroy cars and this creates competition among players. When a player (literally) unlocks Ralph, Lizzie, or George, then they become playable characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rampage 2: Universal Tour", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87861.description: Skip-Bo Breakers imports Climbing Games concepts into the Skip-Bo brand, familiar to the U.S. market. The traditional Skip-Bo cards are replaced by 64 plastic tiles, shaped like sideways chevrons, and rather than trying to simply sequence their cards, a lead player plays a set of cards: a single tile, a pair, running pairs, or a straight. Then, subsequent players may play the same type of set, or play a "breaker" — analogous to a bomb in traditional climbing game vernacular.
87861.name: Skip-Bo Breakers

87862.name: Secret Defense
87862.description:
User Summary

Dr Mack Adam, a French brilliant scientist, is suspected of working with enemy agents. As a new recruit of the French counter-espionage agency, your task is to explore the doctor's house, collect evidence and find a way to stop the spy ring's plans.

SECRET DEFENSE is a graphical adventure game. Instead of using a text interpreter or an icon system, the game displays a list of all actions available in current location. The player selects an action, validate and the game displays the results. Of course, some actions are necessary to advancing the plot, others are dangerous as there are quite a few traps in the house. The game also displays a 3d map of the house (a 2d view is also available), the player's inventory and an image of the current location. There is no savegame feature.

87863.name: Exodus: Aufstieg und Fall
87863.description:
Exodus: Aufstieg und Fall (Rise and Fall) is a light 4x game. The players take control over an intergalactic race and have to explore the universe, expand their Empire, build trading routes and send ressources to the matching planets and attack trading routes and planets of the other players.

Exodus is played with 2-4 players on a random hex-board. Each player builds an unique deck of 60-80 cards (out of 8 different types of cards). During the game the empires rise and each player desides, when he wants to fall to get victory points. The the player builds up a new Empire with a different starting planet. To conquer a planet, the player have to build an outpost and get influence on this planet (depends on the number of possible ouposts on this planet). Each time he get influence, surrounding planets with other players outposts will also get influence-tokens.
Each planet needs one out of four ressources to get victory points . To get the right ressources to the matching planet a player has to trade with the Galactic Senat, other players or move ressources through the trading routes. At the end of the turn each player bids on a special Senat-action for the next turn.
If a player counquers a planet, he'll get a special action each turn, but can't play as many cards as before. So each planet makes the players game more static and predictable.

Depending on the deck a player chooses, each player tries to get victory points through conquering, producing, attacking or trading or a mix of these types.

87864.name: Dust: A post-apocalyptic role-playing boardgame
87864.description:
Dust is a real-time post nuclear role-playing game without a gamemaster. Each player creates an unique character with different abilities und items.
The mission book shows the setup of the scenario and the time until the mission failed (1-4 days, 24 minutes playtime per day).

Each player uses sandtimers to determinate the action he'll use. Every opponent has a small sheet with his abilities and actions he'll do, if a player interacts with the NPC.
The players have to suceed the main mission, but can always accept secondary missions to get extra experience and items or money.

87865.name: 3D Fight
87865.description:
User Summary

In 3D Fight, the player pilots a starship fighting hordes of invaders while flying over an unknown planet's surface. The goal is to reach the enemy base and destroy it.

The game is split in several stages, each with a different landscapes (a planet surface, a trench, a tunnel) and colour schemes. Enemy waves come at the player from the front as well as from behind (there is a radar display to help avoid these), and some of the levels have hazards like falling meteorites. The player must also monitor the spacecraft's fuel level (additional fuel can be picked up by destroying containers).

87867.description:
From the publisher's website:

Perilous Trials is the second Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. As Lucy struggles to remember the details of the party, she is approached by the mysterious Mr. Dart who invites her to join a very old, selective order.

Perilous Trials is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
87867.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Perilous Trials Asylum Pack

40270.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10579: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

87868.name: Azad
87868.description:
The game Azad is based on Ian M. Banks novel "the player of games".
Each player tries to get civilisation points with his tribes by building villages, towns and a metropolis. Each tribe has to earn ressources to support the villages and build new tribes.
Depending on the area the tribe moves, the attributes (power, movement, ressources) of each tribe changes and each player has to take a look at the enemy tribes and defend their own territory, before they take control of your ressources and cities.

87870.name: A 320
87870.description:
User Summary

A 320 is a mix of flight simulator and adventure game. As the pilot of an Airbus A320, you must first prepare your flight (pick up your flight plan, consult with the meteorologist and the maintenance crew), fly your plane to its destination and deal with a terrorist plot.

The game is split in three parts: an adventure prologue where the player prepare the flight, a flight simulation (flying an airbos A320), and another adventure part where the goal is to deal with the man hijacking the plane and avoid the passengers getting hurt. The game uses digitized pictures and a system of icons for player input.

The game doesn't have a savegame feature.

87871.description:
In Bra$ilis, most of the citizen that come to politics try to take advantage of their position with schemes, make some extra money and raise in status and power. What move Bra$ilis is the power, in this game you will be able to feel that power.
Each player takes roll of a politic that has as a main objective obtain the majority of votes.
And for that, every move counts!! Make partnerships, create intrigues, lie and make a fool of other politics... in resume, everything you find in politics! Run away from scandals and corruption and try, at max, help (or trick) the population for more votes.

In each turn, players reveal a card/news containing three atributes: votes, image and money. Each of this political news will be disputed by the players according to their strategy. Players have a set of cards in their hands and place their political influence and power in front of them or in front of the other players, when they think their participation is enought they can chose to 'pass'. The politician that cointains the higher value of political power in front of him by the time everyone has passed is considered the autor of that scandal published and recieve all the information displayed in the card.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game accumulates more votes.

In the path to the victory, the administration of your image and money are essentials! With money you can buy political help, hiring a lawyer, marketeer or even a advertiser.
Your image, despite being the first tie-braker, will help you gain more or less cards during the game. But beware! The population is not watching the corruption quietly, there is a scale for their 'angryness' and they can start a revolution at any time!!
































































Em Bra$ilis, os cidadãos que entram para a vida pública querem, quase sempre, se aproveitar dos diversos esquemas e falcatruas e, com isso, faturar uma graninha extra e de quebra um pouco de poder e status. Afinal o que move Bra$ilis é o Poder e, nesse jogo, você poderá experimentar esse poder...
Cada jogador será um político de Bra$ilis que fará de tudo para, ao final do jogo, obter o maior número de votos possíveis e, assim, obter maior poder político. Mas não pense que isso é tarefa fácil, pois todos estarão brigando pelo mesmo objetivo e a população estará de olho no que acontece no Planalto.
E nessa hora vale tudo!! Alianças, intrigas, trapaças, acusações falsas, manipulações... Enfim, tudo que existe na política! Fuja dos escândalos de corrupção e tente, ao máximo, ajudar (ou enganar) a população para conseguir mais votos.

Source: Back of the box.
87871.name: Bra$ilis

87873.name: XXXopoly
87873.description:
One word, easy. XXXopoly was designed so that your mind can be focused on sex not on rules.

Roll the dice and proceed to a sexual space. Each sexual space has a sexual act. Acts range from foreplay fun to hardcore intercourse. Whenever your partner lands on a sexual space you own, they perform that specific sexual act on you. You can either perform the sexual act, or pay a fine to get out of it. The game is that simple.

Giving someone an orgasm is just as pleasureable as having one yourself. thats why XXXopoly includes Hot and Heavy and Erotic Chest cards. These cards range from object play, to role play, to kama sutra positions to bring you to new sexual realms.

Finger someone, tongue someone, tease someone, longer and harder by purchasing time chips from the bank. Each time chip increases the time of the action on the sexual space of your choice throughout the entire game.

Finally, look for the specially marked spaces around the board: strip teases, red light districts, even an S&M chamber. You are guaranteed to get laid every time you play!

source-www.xxxopoly.com

87874.name: The Lords of Tarsa
87874.description:
From the Publisher:

The year is 1092 in the Age of Itania. King Girart of Mirensa, villified as the killer of children, schemes to bring the Nine Kingdoms under his crown while Safiro of Tivonna engages magi and spies to thwart Girart’s ambition. Mad King Bertrant of Ossirenza bears the burden to defend the lands of Men against marauding Krek even as his galleys war on Tivonnan ships to satisfy his raging temperament.

In the wild North the rangers, always outnumbered, battle the depredations of ruthless Kyaksa tribesmen who strike from mountain strongholds. In the steppes to the east the Solok tribes battle each other to satisfy the blood-lust of their gods and raid the West for its riches. The Vashaniin, an ancient and prideful people, spurn involvement in the affairs of Men while they prepare for the coming of a threat more dire than any of the petty squabbles of the West—an enemy that even now may be probing the defenses of the gray walls of the mountains of the Eastern Divide.

Lords of Tarsa is a heroic fantasy Basic Roleplaying game setting.

BASIC ROLEPLAYING MONOGRAPHS are longer works by one or more authors on a subject of import to Basic Roleplaying players. On these products the author has also fulfilled the functions of editor and layout artist; we at Chaosium have done little in the way of editorial. We found these works compelling and thought that you would enjoy them. Through the publication of monographs we can offer our most loyal fans more information more easily, and evaluate the potential of these works for eventual release to the wholesale market.

87875.name: The Functions of Role-Playing Games
87875.description:
Subtitle: How Participants Create Community, Solve Problems and Explore Identity

Publisher's description:

This study takes an analytical approach to the world of role-playing games, providing a theoretical framework for understanding their psychological and sociological functions. Sometimes dismissed as escapist and potentially dangerous, role-playing actually encourages creativity, self-awareness, group cohesion and "out-of-the-box" thinking. The book also offers a detailed participant-observer ethnography on role-playing games, featuring insightful interviews with 19 participants of table-top, live action and virtual games.

199937.name: The Card Game of Oz: The Marvelous Land of Oz

87876.description:
Over one hundred years ago, L. Frank Baum introduced the world to the wondrous Land of Oz. Now, experience these familiar characters, fantastic locations, and disturbing creatures as never before imagined.

The Card Game of Oz introduces an innovative new game system called the Storyline Game System™ that adds strategy to your challenging and fun adventures through Oz. Each player takes on the role of an author attempting to construct the best story in the world of Oz. During the game, players will attempt to bring together objects, characters and locations that are appropriate together – for example, the Tin Woodman and his Oil Can – while avoiding hazards like the field of poppies and terrible beasts and villains like the Kalidahs or the Wicked Witch of the West.

Each round players roll a special set of dice to determine the number of points they have for drawing and playing cards. The number of dice increases during the game, allowing the game to scale naturally while you play. The game ends when a player is able to move a Prime character – that is, one of the main characters of the story – from her Title card all the way to The End, but doing so is no simple race because the character who triggers the endgame is worth no points toward victory.

Featuring hundreds of fascinating characters, events, and vistas, Oz is a world that has stood the test of time. Construct an iconic tale that is all your own!
87876.name: The Card Game of Oz

87877.name: Pickle Wars
87877.description:
Pickle Wars is a platform game where aliens, resembling pickles, invade the planet. The game alternates between a man and a woman as they collect "Salad Shooters" they can use to defeat the alien invaders.

Players can pick up things such as junk food (for points) and carrots (for health).

Source: User Summary

87878.name: The Werewolf Players Guide (1st Edition)
87878.description:
A Supplemental players guide for Werewolf: the Apocalypse, this book contains numerous new Merits and Flaws, New totems, New Gifts, and new skills.

It also includes expanded sections on the society of the Garou.

It also introduces rules for Non-Wolf Shapeshifters, including Spiders, Large Cats, Ravens, Bears, Alligator/Dinosaurs, Cobras, Coyotes, Rats, and Sharks.

87879.name: The Deadly Shadow
87879.description:
From the back cover:

Can you track down Dimitrius, the human time bomb?

You are a crack operator for the Special Security Agency. Now the agency is counting on you to find the deadly Dimitrius, a human time bomb who can explode with all the force of an atomic blast! But before you start your search, you'll need an undercover identity. What should you be?

If you decide to pose as a professional gambler, turn to page 74. If you pretend to be an art collector, turn to page 23. Think carefully! Dimitrius is dangerous. He might shatter you into a thousand fiery pieces--unless you can outsmart him and save the world from disaster!

What happens next in the story? It all depends on the choice you make. How does the story end? Only you can find out! And the best part is that you can keep reading and rereading until you've had not one but many incredibly daring experiences!

87881.name: Golden Age
87881.description:
The Ancient Greek world is a backwater. Greek speaking cities are under constant threat. The great Persian Empire to the East, pirates in the seas, barbarians to the north, legends of terrible monsters haunting the land, bitter feuding kings, and incessant corruption plague the ancient Greek world.

Though from this fire rises greatness; warriors of legend, leaders whose names will be ingrained in history, pioneering inventors, and a city that may yet be the cradle of the future.

In Golden Age players take on the roles of the leaders of emerging city-states in the ancient Greek world. Beset from all sides, they must put away their differences if they are to weather the coming storm. Will you work together with your fellow Greek to grow, nurture and protect your world? Or will you be a zealous hegemon and write your own history? Either way Greece must stand to see the dawning of a new age or there will be no tomorrow.

87882.name: The Luckiest Day of Your Life
87882.description:
From back cover:

Will you luck out, or run out of luck?

You and your friends are at a traveling carnival, playing games of chance and skill. After winning a seemingly impossible game, you are offered a choice of two prizes by a mysterious attendant. You can choose either a blue-green crystal or a book entitled How to Get Lucky. Neither seems very exciting, but the attendant assures you that these prizes could change your life! Which will you choose?

If you pick the crystal, turn to page 7. If you take the book, turn to page 67. Choose carefully! Your good luck could bring you wealth and adventure. But if you misuse your good fortune, you could lose everything--even your life!

What happens next in the story? It all depends on the choices you make. How does the story end? Only you can find out! And the best part is that you can keep reading and rereading until you've had not one but many incredibly daring experiences!

87883.name: MySims SkyHeroes
87883.description:
User Summary

MySims SkyHeroes is a flight game in the MySims series. Players control a nameless pilot leading the resistance against the evil Morcubus, a villain attempting to take over the skyways. As the game progresses the player will gain experience that allows them to customize their plane and purchase upgrades.

87884.name: The Banner (Issue 17 - Feb 2001)
87884.description:
From In This Issue:

Editorial: Ask and Ye Shall Receive
Feature Artist: Quentin Westcott
BayRPS Info: What's the BayRPS all about?
In Review: A Review of the D&D Movie by Chad Williams
Playing an Evil Game: The Pitfalls of Evil Campaigns by Art Lierman
The Iron Fist of the GM: part 1 of 3 by Jesus Hernandez
Big Game News: The DnD Community Council
The Community Approach to Open Gaming by Brad Bernis
Item of the Month: Staff of Necromancy
RPGA News
Coming Events
In-Store Gaming
Local Gaming Groups
Want Ads

87885.name: Ninety-Nine Nights II
87885.description:
User Summary

Ninety-Nine Nights II is a hack and slash title for the Xbox 360. It is the sequel to Ninety-Nine Nights. The game is set in the fantasy realm of Orphea, and darkness is swelling through the kingdom. The Lord of Night has mustered a legion of minions and is destroying everything in his path. The players control one of a group of five heroes that must stop the Lord of Night’s rampage.

Gameplay is loosely similar to the Dynasty Warriors series, with the player needing to combat hordes of weak enemies in order to complete their objectives. There are a number of different ‘super enemies’ that have more health and special attacks, as well as bosses that are more dangerous still. Each mission has the same general goal – fight through the masses to complete the set task. The tasks vary from defeating particular enemies to saving allies to destroying enemy structures.

The player can choose any of the five heroes as their character in each level, and the different characters provide a range of unique abilities. In addition, the different heroes each have a personalized story that provides a particular view on the war against the Lord of Night. There is an online co-op mode available for two players to team up. This mode includes specifically designed co-op levels that maintain the difficulty level for the game.

87886.name: Short Rules
87886.description: This is a rule book for miniature wargames in the Napoleonic period. The book contains the rules, tables and charts needed to recreate battles in the Napoleonic era. The book is written by Leon Tucker.

87887.name: Afghanistan 2010
87887.description: Card game for 2 Players. One player is the Americans. The other player is the Taliban. 2006-2010+ Simulation of the ongoing conflict in Afghanistan following the Taliban resurgence after the US led Invasion in 2001. Players recruit allies and steal or neutralize their opponents allies. The player with the most points worth of allies at the end of the game wins. Action and Event cards modify attacks and card play. Every Ally has a special ability that gives you an edge in the conflict. Influence tokens are used to recruit Allies as well as draw extra cards and get extra attacks.

87888.name: State Prison
87888.description:
Designer blurb:

INTRIGUE BEHIND BARS
Guards help prisoners dig an escape tunnel. A wannabe lives the thug life. The warden trades places with his twin on death row. Scientologists corner the potato market.

Welcome to the big house.

boardgamehonor.13176: 2011 Gra Roku Game of the Year Nominee

87890.description:
[from publisher's website]

Pret-a-Porter is an economic strategy game set in a world of fashion. Players run clothes companies and fight for dominance during fashion shows. It is – perhaps – one of the most cruel and ruthless of all our games. Money can be a dangerous weapon.

During the game players open new branches and outlets, hire new workers and try to gain new capabilities. New Design Agencies, Brand stores or Preparation rooms are opened, Accountants, Models and Designers are hired, lucrative contracts are signed to allow for short-term profits and expand company’s competencies.

Every single month player’s company gains new capabilities.

Each quarter held fashion shows – each player has to prepare a collection of clothing and has to show it on the show. The public, media, experts estimate collections in four categories and award prizes and diplomas. The more awards (represented by ‘stars’ in the game) will be collected at the show, the more money the players earn for selling their collection!

Will you get award for best Trends? Will you manage to be best in Public Relations and get the Media award? Will you earn more ‘stars’ than your opponent?

If you win ‘stars’, your opponents don’t.
If you win ‘stars’, you earn more money. Your opponents don’t.
If you win ‘stars’, you earn money, you hire new stuff, you get better. Your opponents don’t.

That is why during show you will kill for every single ‘star’. Welcome to the hell…


Pret-a-Porter is 2-4 players boardgame, unique mix of deep economy strategy and direct interaction. Low luck element, many important decisions to be made and many strategies that can be used to acclaim victory. With wide range of different employees, different buildings and contracts you can create your unique company every single time.
87890.name: Prêt-à-Porter

87891.name: The Lacuna Expanse
87891.description:
The Expanse is a region of space with millions of habitable worlds. You can play with or compete against thousands of other players as you build your empire, fight off spies in a battle for cold war supremacy, form alliances, search the expanse for lost ancient artifacts, and more.

Source: The Game Website.

87892.name: Topologic
87892.description:
Topologic is a game of logic and deduction, but also uses piece movement.

Every game is played over two rounds. In the first round one player plays the role of the referee (who hides a secret), the other the role of the seekers. In the second round the roles reverse.

The 5 seekers are moved across the playing field (an assembled area of connected Nestortiles). Then the referee counts the score of the currently occupied locations (1 point for a color and/or number match) and announces the sum of the scored points. As they get more information, the seekers can deduce where the secret is hidden.

Topologic is abstract, but players are encouraged to come up with a thematic background they like. This even includes renaming the game for each session.

87893.name: Take It or Leave It
87893.description:
Take It or Leave It is a game title asking to be mocked by those who don't like the design, so here's hoping it goes over well with audiences.

What is the game, you ask? Each player has a hand of four task cards showing dice combinations and other tasks that the player is trying to achieve during a game round, such as a sum of pips less than 13, or two white dice and one black die; each card has a point value on it, with the tougher cards obviously being worth more points. Someone rolls a bunch of white, black and red dice, then players take turns choosing a die from the pool. Each player also holds one action card that lets him manipulate the dice to better achieve his tasks.

On a turn, a player either takes a die or passes from the round. Once everyone has passed, players assign dice to their task cards, with red dice counting as either black or white. Complete your tasks, and you'll cheer (and score points); have dice unused, and you'll wish that you'd never been born – or you'll just lose a couple of points. Depends on how much of a drama queen you are.

After each round, a player refills his hand of cards in the appropriate proportions, and after each player has started a round 1-3 times (depending on the number of players), the game ends and players tally their points.

87895.name: Manufacture
87895.description:
Manufacture is an economic simulation game where players compete in variant aspects of the manufacturing process. Their decisions concern the production cost (setup, materials purchases, wages, rents), the sales (volume and value), the cash flow, the research of new products and optimization of current production, the financing of their actions, etc.

These tough economic decisions are being unfold over a factory layout where the positiong of the different modules is also important. The manufacturing process involves different stages of processing, routing and the efficient worker allocation.

There are 3 different types of goods (raw materials, intermediate goods and final goods) which are traded between the players and the outer world (in all directions) via contracts or a free market.

87896.name: Anymeals
87896.description:
Source: Blacksmith Games website.

Floop is a fun and exceptional arcade physics game where the player tries to shoot an acorn into the mouth of a squirrel.

This sounds easy, but wait until you try it - you need to develop some skills and practice to become successful.There is a lot of variety in the game - the further you get the more challenges and tools wait for you.

87897.name: Trucks & Skulls
87897.description:
Source: The Game Website.

This is the physics puzzler you've been waiting for! Smash NITRO-BURNING MONSTER TRUCKS into piles of GIANT SKULLS!

Join the INSANE STUNT CIRCUS on the TOUR OF DOOM, demolishing steel fortresses on Hell's Highway, The Haunted Wastelands, and Industrial Armageddon. Rev up your engines and launch your trucks from the Screamstrip Ramp, then tap the screen to make them pull stunts and EXPLODE as they crash into buildings and scaffolds to destroy lurking, leering skulls.

87898.name: Rabbit
87898.description:
Rabbit is a cooperative game for 1-2 players.
(from the website)
It is Spring and You are the leader of a herd of rabbits that needs to recover if it is to survive the next Winter. Your herd was once over twenty strong but disease and predators have brought you down to your last four rabbits. To make matters worse, humans and their machines have been approaching and your warren may be in grave danger.
To win the game, you must have 12 or more Rabbits in play at the end of the last turn. Each game consists of 37 turns representing the weeks between Spring and Winter. You will need to make efficient use of your rabbits' abilities to Collect Food, Produce New Rabbits, and Explore New Areas if your herd is to survive.
The challenge in Rabbit comes not from competition with other players but from the game itself. Rabbit can be enjoyed as a 1 player game or as a cooperative 2 player game. ( in a 2 player game, 1 player controls the Thinker and the other player controls Scouts and Fighters )

87899.name: Gun Bros
87899.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

The Freakishly Rugged Advanced Genetics Galactic Enforcement Division (AKA F.R.A.G.G.E.D) specializes in the development and deployment of superhuman special agents. Headed since its formation by the brilliant soldier-turned-scientist Mother Gun, its current roster consists of only two active field operatives, code-named Percy and Francis Gun. Their lifelong mission: to protect the cosmos from the Tyrannical Oppressors of Life known as T.O.O.L.

Like a super-powered fungus gone haywire, the evil T.O.O.L organization has grown from the dankest levels of the criminal underworld to spread its own brand of malevolent funk to every corner of the galaxy. Most recently, they’ve set their sights on harvesting the rare element Xplodium in an effort to create even more powerful weapons to enslave the universe - But not if the GUN BROS have anything to do about it!

87900.name: The Smurfs' Village
87900.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Based on the original cartoon and comic art, players begin the game under the guidance of Papa Smurf, with only a single mushroom house and a lone plowed plot of land. From there, things quickly progress, allowing players to build specialized houses, elaborate gardens with colorful crops, bridges to span running rivers, trodden paths, and more.

87901.name: Garters & Ghouls
87901.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Arise to the strange and twisted world of Garters & Ghouls, the newest action adventure franchise from Namco! Control and command the not-too-dead Marie Dupois in her summons to battle the minions of the Thrum and horrors beyond description! Unearth archaic weapons of death, destruction, and massively mind-blowing power-ups! Share your achievements with your friends through Facebook connect. With Garters & Ghouls, the action never dies!

87903.name: Pancha Keliya
87903.description:
Ancient boardgame from India meaning "The game of five". The goal of the game is to collect 3 pieces in a treasure island. The game play is simple: the player throws the 6 special dice and put his pieces in the path. Captures are possible too, and the winner is the player that moves all 3 pieces to his island.

A Sri Lankan race game for two players. It has elements of Ludo-type games, in as much that you both start with three men and you win by getting all three 'home'. The board is unusual, in that it is not a 'circle', rather it is a track of 31 spaces, with some spaces marked as castles and you are safe from being sent home on them.

87904.name: Trivial Pursuit: Master Edition
87904.description:
The new 2010 Master Edition is the successor of the Genus edition. It includes 3,000 all-new questions that will challenge even the savviest Trivial Pursuit player.

It comes with the well known game play of the old editions and with a electronic timer to keep up the pace.

The contained questions are up-to-date so it will be easier to play with people of the new generations.

The goal of the game is to collect wedges of each color by answering the questions and to answer the so called master question at the end of the game to be the MASTER.

87905.name: Blazing Rose
87905.description:
Subtitle: A Story Game of Romantic Rivalry

Publisher description:

Several friends have all fallen in love with the same person! In Blazing Rose, you will tell the story of these Rivals, and find out which of them wins the affection of their Beloved in the end. What schemes will they devise, what stunts will they undertake, to stand out from the crowd and win the love they seek? And what happens to those who strive, but suffer rejection? Can friendship survive a competition with such stakes as these?

Blazing Rose is a collaborative storytelling game for three to six players.

87906.name: Console Legends
87906.description:
Publisher Blurb

Console Legends is a GMless game of story-telling. Players control the characters and story as a whole, without "owning" any particular element. The rules exist to make the game flow more smoothly, and to give it the feel of console RPGs.
The core of the game is the Visions system, in which each player writes down a number of things they want others to describe as the game progresses. When you describe someone else's Vision, you receive Boss Dice to use at the end of an Act (the only place that dice are used). As the group plays together more, they become more familiar with each other's ideas of the game, and are able to bring each others' Visions into play more easily.

87907.description:
1865 Sardinia is a board game belonging to the 18xx series for 2-4 players and set on the Sardinia island (and Corsica).

Players play the role of 19th century entrepreneurs investing in the construction as well as the financial and operational management of railways. Selling and buying shares on the stock market, seeking new sources of funding, laying track and placing stations, running trains and paying dividends are all basic elements of 18xx games.

In addition, 1865 Sardinia has several features that make it different from other 18xx titles. The most important distinctions are:

a traffic based system that makes calculating company's revenues easier and faster
foreign investors (Dragons) trade in certificates in addition to human players
an absorption mechanism that allows companies to acquire each other




Other interesting points:

before phase 5, all companies start as minor companies with 40%/20%/20%/20% shares
converting a company from minor to major requires a direct route from a company base to a historical destination city
private companies become 2 trains when transferred to a company and also provide extra traffic
buying trains from bank makes the share price jump up
the last 2, 3, and 4 train comes with a discount
withholding money in company doesn't reduce the share price
tiles can be replaced with another tile of same color, provided the current connections are retained
bankrupt players are given enough loans to keep them in game, loans are then deducted from final score in the end





Dragons


during stock rounds, the Dragons will also trade
each stock round begins with a Dragon and Dragons also play between each player
dragons are interested in company's rank, an indicator based on the sum of trains phase and tokens on board, followed on a special table on the board
dragons will immediately sell certificates in companies ranked red and will buy certificates ranked green, according to a fairly simple and consistent algorithm.
players can buy shares from Dragons, but must pay a premium for well-ranked shares
share prices are adjusted down when shares are sold by Dragons or the company president



Traffic system


when a company places a station marker, it gets to collect traffic chips from the board along the route
mines also produce traffic chips, but diminish in value as the game proceeds
each traffic chip is worth $10 in revenue
revenues are the smaller value of total revenue in traffic chips and train capacity available
phase 2 trains, for example, have 8 capacity each, so if company has two of those for 16 capacity and 14 traffic chips, it will make $140 in revenue, while adding three chips would increase the revenue to $160 because the capacity hits the roof at that point
87907.name: 1865: Sardinia

87909.name: Don't Walk in Winter Wood
87909.description:
Publisher's description:

Don't Walk in Winter Wood is a role-playing game of folkloric horror. Its lite mechanics and unique narrative style are designed to emulate the feel of spooky campfire stories.

87910.name: The Dynasty
87910.description:
Synopsis taken from source book
"The game The Dynasty is a roleplaying game about the ruling family of an empire. This game is a storytelling game and a competitive game at the same time. The game plays in three sessions, each of them three hours long. Each session is featuring a critical era of a ruler’s domination, possibly ending with the fall of that ruler and coronation of another member of the family. Players will control the members of this family. Their goal will be to take hold of the power over their country."

87911.name: Quest Júnior
87911.description: Quiz game for kids inspired by Trivial Pursuit. The mechanic is like a race where the players must answer questions and advance the pawn if the answer is correct. The first player to reach the last space and answer the chalenge question correctly is the winner.

87913.name: Acerte o Acento
87913.description:
Educational game where kids must use correct accentuation and backtick.

At the start of the game, each player receives a pawn and four cards. Each player must roll the dice and move the pawn. There are four kinds of spaces: opponent color, all colors, your color and take a card. If the pawn falls in one of the first two, the player must try to answer correctly a word in one of the opponents cards. The player with most point after 3 rounds is the winner.

87914.name: Rat on a Skateboard
87914.description:
Grab that board and get ready for a kickflippin' adventure down the Banana Harbor, Stunt Road and 30 other challenging courses.

Source: The Developer Website.

87915.name: Astronut
87915.description:
Let gravity and guts be your guide as you blast off on a planet-hopping adventure of cosmic proportions. Travel to uncharted galaxies, gather star shards and avoid unfriendly life forms, all on your quest to explore the universe and become the ultimate hero.

Addictive, arcade-style play for both novice & advanced gamers
24 Challenging Levels across 6 sectors
40 Formidable achievements to unlock
Fully optimized for Apple’s stunning Retina Display
Saved game status – play for five minutes or five hours
Compatible with iOS 4 multi-tasking
Full support for Game Center

Source: The Developer Website.

87916.name: Mexican Standoff

rpghonor.13933: 2006 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up

87916.description:
User Summary:
The group plays a group of gangsters, hitmen, or other criminal-types standing over a pile of money, locked in a “Mexican standoff” after a heist gone bad. The details of this heist, as well as the players' role in it, are made up and improvised in play.

87917.name: Reiner Knizia's Keltis Oracle
87917.description:
Keltis Oracle is the visually appealing sequel to the famous Keltis board game (closely related to Lost Cities: the board game), winner of the Game of the Year 2008! Between 1 and 4 players on the same iPad (or with computer opponents) can play this exciting new board game from one of the world's leading board game developers, Dr. Reiner Knizia. A well balanced mix of strategy and luck, it takes about 30 minutes to play.

In Keltis Oracle, you guide your pieces into a spiral of stones, collecting rewards on the way, such as wishing stones and mirrors. Movement is allowed only by creating sequences of specific coloured cards. The stones in the spiral have special effects which enhance the strategical thinking required even further.

Together all these features make an exciting game for everybody!

Source: The Game Website.

87918.name: Age of Empires III: Complete Collection
87918.description:
Source: Microsoft:

Full description

Age of Empires III: Complete Collection

Immerse yourself in the award-winning strategy experience. Microsoft Game Studios brings you three epic Age of Empires III games in one monumental collection for the first time. Command mighty European powers looking to explore new lands in the New World; or jump eastward to Asia and determine the outcome of its struggles for power.

* Playable Asian civilizations. Lead one of three unique Asian civilizations Japan, China or India to expand its empire and fight for control in the Eastern world. Each Asian civilization, led by powerful leaders, will have unique groups, armies and wonders, as well as buildings that reflect the culture s architectural style.
* New game-play elements. Extending the innovative game-play of Age of Empires III, Age of Empires III: The Asian Dynasties and War Chiefs will introduce new ways of winning and trading, random map styles that feature remixes of classic Age of Empires game styles, 15 Asian Wonders and New World adventures.
* Exciting new single-player campaign. Returning to the historical, civilization-based single-player campaigns, Age of Empires III: The Asian Dynasties will offer gamers who enjoy the solo experience a chance to engage in strategic combat with Japan, China or India through several engrossing scenarios. Or lead New World expeditions with War Chiefs.
* Expanding a successful formula. Age of Empires III: The Asian Dynasties is the second expansion pack for the massively popular Age of Empires III, one of the fastest-selling titles in the franchise history, leading and innovating the real-time strategy genre through exciting and revolutionary game-play features.
* Games for Windows franchise. This expansion pack will also ship as a Games for Windows title, offering easier installation, reliability standards and support for key features of Windows Vista, including the Games Explorer and Parental Controls.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
OS: Microsoft Windows XP SP2 or higher
Processor: PC with 1.4 GHz equivalent or higher processor
RAM: 256 MB of system RAM
Hard Drive: 6 GB available hard disk space
Video Card: 64 MB video card with support for hardware transformation and lighting required
DirectX 9.0 or later
Other: Microsoft Mouse or compatible pointing device
Online Multi-player:56K dial-up Internet Access or LAN required for online/multiplayer
Soundcard: Sound card, speakers or headphones required for audio
Drive: 32x speed or faster CD-ROM drive

87919.name: War of the Dead: Chapter One (Collected)
87919.description:
Publisher Blurb:

WHERE WERE YOU ON THE DAY THE EARTH DIED?

An unexplained cataclysm is infecting the world. Millions are dying and rising as flesh-consuming ghouls. Entire cities are roaming graveyards, and even the countryside is overrun with creatures in search of living flesh.

You begin in the first days of the outbreak, trapped aboard the maiden voyage of a state-of-the-art cruise ship that quickly becomes a floating graveyard. As you manage to escape back to land, the world around you is just about dead. The military can’t stop the spread of the infection, the government has relocated to the Rocky Mountains, and those remaining are banding together for survival - some seeking safety in numbers and others seeking to use their numbers to overpower and dominate the weak.

Can you survive in a world looking to eat you and turn you into another walking corpse? Can you trust other survivors not to kill you and take your supplies?

More importantly - when you discover something that could save the world, will you be strong enough to deliver it to the right people?

War of the Dead as a four-chapter adventure series that takes you from the first stages of the outbreak, and all the way into a world forever war torn and changed by the advancement of the Living Dead!

87920.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In December 3076, Devlin Stone marshaled the nations of the Inner Sphere and began Operation SCOUR. The two-year final push to Terra was the bloodiest fighting seen in centuries. In the end, Terra had been freed with the Word of Blake scattered to the darkest corners of the universe. Stepping into that vacuum, Stone forged a new "Terran Hegemony" in The Republic of the Sphere. With the end of the Jihad, the survivors are rebuilding their shattered armies, introducing new machines to replace those whose factories ceased to exist in the fires of the Jihad.

BattleTech Technical Readout: 3085 gives a detailed look at the machines introduced during the waning days of the Jihad and into the founding days of Devlin Stone’s Republic of the Sphere. This book includes the latest ’Mechs, battle armor, aerospace and vehicles as well as new late-Jihad support vehicles. In addition, this sourcebook heralds the long-awaited update of Technical Readout: Project Phoenix, featuring brand-new art and additional variants. Conventional infantry make their Technical Readout debut with fifty-six individual infantry formations from classic foot infantry to xeno-planetary soldiers. And finally, after more than twenty years of silence, Land-Air BattleMechs explode back into a Technical Readout with a look at the original four LAMs and their Star League history.
87920.name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout 3085

87921.name: Poker Night at the Inventory
87921.description:
Poker Night at the Inventory is a video poker game developed by Telltale Games. It features four crossover characters: Tycho from the Penny Arcade webcomic, Max from the Sam & Max franchise, the Heavy Weapons Guy from Team Fortress 2, and Strong Bad from the Homestar Runner web series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Poker Night at the Inventory", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87922.name: Word.Nut
87922.description:
In a Nut Shell - This game is all about making WORDS.
It's fun to play and quick to learn.

Your objective is to make as many words as you can by using the ‘Nuts’ provided within a pre-set time deadline. (10 minutes, 30 minutes, or even days at a time - you decide.)

Play Word.Nut as a SOLO or MULTI player game. All players play AT THE SAME TIME.


Mix all the Nuts around inside the Word.Nut shell. Then open the zipper and leave open.
Each player or team takes a ‘lucky dip’ to gather a supply of 12 Nuts (no peeking).
Set your own stopwatch or timer to notify you after the agreed playing time.
Play. Make Words. Go nuts.
Play till time runs out or all of the Nuts are used up.
The winner is the person who achieves the highest score for the words they have made. The game rules show a clear scoring chart.


Invented in New Zealand by BERRY.

87924.name: Brother Ptolemy & The Hidden Kingdom
87924.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 4E D&D Adventure Setting for 5th Level Characters. The heroes have set out to find Adalisa Leighman, the lost daughter of a powerful merchant baron, and along the way they find themselves caught up into a plot to overthrow the hearts and minds of thousands in the city-state of Corwyn. All the while, the Red Harvest ravages the land, withering everything in its path and driving the sick mad with a thirst for blood. Fighting to drive back the plague, mysterious Red Monks from the Hidden Kingdom roam the land, cleansing the infected and proselytizing survivors into their own Hidden Kingdom. No one has yet been able to withstand the power the Kingdom, so the future of Corwyn, the life of Adalisa Leighman, and the conquest of the Red Harvest are now in the heroes' hands...

87925.name: The Goonies Board Game
87925.description:
From the Wired.Com review of The Goonies 25th Anniversary Edition DVD Set:

".... the set’s true treasure - a special Goonies-themed board game.

The bulk of the box set’s real estate is devoted to this game, and immediately upon cracking open the shrink wrap you are taken by its diminutive size. Still, if The Goonies taught us anything it’s that size doesn’t always matter, and I’m happy to report that this is the case here. Though the board itself is only about half the size of your average game, it’s actually a brilliantly colored fold-up printed on super sturdy laminated stock that appears perfectly capable of standing up to multiple years’ worth of play sessions. The same can be said for the game’s Move Cards which, while not quite as brawny as most CCG cards, are thick enough to get the job done.

Gameplay is fairly simple and properly reflects the spirit of the source materials - players take the role of one of five Goonies (Mikey, Data, Mouth, Chunk or Andy) and use a three-card hand in an attempt to escape One-Eyed Willy’s cave. Players disarm traps to collect Gold Doubloons, and the first to reach the "Escape" square with three such Doubloons wins the game. The process is complicated by a trio of tricky Skull Spaces (only one of which contains the necessary key) that must be passed to reach the exit. This is balanced out by a fun selection of Special Move Cards that allow players to switch places with or steal gold from opponents. While certainly not the most engaging board game experience in movie fandom, it does manage to channel the proper amount of nostalgia and charm in a small but effective package."

87926.name: Yago Pool
87926.description: A dexterity game that is a combination of regular pool and Tic-Tac-Toe. Each player has five balls that they shoot into the nine holes in the middle of the board, trying to form three in a row. The winner of a round is the first to pocket three in a row or pocket all 5 of their balls (each worth 1 point). Should a player pocket all 5 balls and form two rows that is worth 3 points. A game is to a mutually agreed total of points. Pocketed balls remain as obstacles on the board, making further shots more difficult. In the "easy" game you flick the balls directly. The "medium" game is also direct flicking, but balls must rebound or be the result of a combination to be pocketed. In the "professional" game you use a blue "cue" ball, which introduces more strategic options such as safety play.

87927.name: Rock 'n Roll
87927.description:
Tie the bandana, put on the sunglasses, shrug on the leather jacket, grab your "axe".........and the dice.

Rock 'n Roll is a free print and play dice game in which players compete to become the biggest rock band and make the greatest albums.

Playable solo or multiplayer, players roll dice over an in-game four year period to practice as a band, go out partying to get fans, get famous in the news, hit the studio to release the next big album, tour the country or just earn some cold, hard cash.

Taking on concepts of Yahtzee and push your luck games, Rock 'n Roll gives hard decisions, direct competition and a rockin' theme. Will you be the next big thing or yet another failed garage band?

87928.name: Sea Ranger
87928.description:
Sea Ranger is a new type of game, where learning is entertaining and family fun. The world's oceans our are largest single resource. If they are abused, mis-managed or ignored; we on land will be worse off for our neglect of this wonderful planet.

Sea Ranger can teach or remind us all of our place in this world; how we use the oceans and waterways; the balance of life and our needs; raise our awareness of how mankind neglects or abuses these incredible places.

Within, on and around our oceans and rivers, hide a multitude of life, living in a state of balance, growing and evolving. Mankind is upsetting this balance to dangerous levels.

Learn, have fun with friends and family, share this knowledge and make a difference in this world.

What is Sea Ranger?

Sea Ranger is a board game designed to educate and entertain 2-6 players about the amazing and diverse wildlife that inhabits the oceans and waterways creating a giant circle of life. We can also learn how mankind uses and abuses this incredible resource we all share.

Sea Ranger is a multi-facetted game. Not only are the players learning about the aquatic environment, they are also learning about themselves. Players learn many qualities of character that are required to either win or prevent collective loss among the players. They share the responsibilities, successes and benefits.

Players learn:;

To share and care for resources.

Collective and individual responsibility.

Manage resources.

To maintain a balance of life and needs.

Value life in all forms as part of the wealth of this world.

Respect each players participation and support.

The best part is that it is fun doing this.

Who Can Play?

The game is aimed at children from 8 years and over and adults. Children will require guidance to assemble.

Children quickly master the rules.

So how does it all work?

The game gives players knowledge and choices. Players can easily discern what feels right or is the right thing to do. We all know within our hearts what is right and good, even if we don't know the answer.

The game uses a special board and tokens. You print out the board and pieces on your colour printer, then cut and assemble the components. To make them last longer or be more durable you may mount them on card or laminate the pieces. Teach the children skills as they read instructions and learn to cut out the pieces.

The game is directed by a special card deck which will present players with a series of events and choices. The players must decide how they will resolve these, sometimes this may require teamwork and sharing. There are many different strategies you can use to win, some can be very quick, others slower.

Part of the game revolves around maintaining the circle of life, ensuring a balance of species to enable life to continue. Each creature is part of that circle and has a unique role to play.

Players must then try and balance mankind's intervention and damage to the seas and waterways. It is a careful juggling act; players individually cannot hope to keep the balance so you need to play cooperatively.

What Do I Get?

Sea Ranger is 26-page colour PDF plus a small rules booklet. The game requires you to print 16-pages to create the board, cards & tokens. Included is the deluxe card set giving you the choice of finish. Where possible we have tried to minimise the graphical content to save ink. Ideally the major components are printed on card. Some simple assembly is required.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

87929.name: NinjaGO
87929.description:
"Calling all Ninja! Lord Garmadon is on a mission: collect all four Golden Weapons of Spinjitzu and, ultimately, rule the world. Can you stop him?"

NinjaGo is a game made out of LEGO bricks.

The playing pieces are LEGO mini figure on a “spinjitzu” spinning disk. Each figure should be armed with one weapon.

Each player then spins the figures so they collide. You win by knocking the other playing piece over, and the take the defeated warrior’s weapon.

You can also play cards that will enchant your warrior.

There is a base set that can be expanded by adding more ninjas and skeleton warriors.

87932.name: Ape Escape: Pumped & Primed
87932.description:
Unlike the other Ape Escape games, this game is more of a party game, similar to Mario Party and Sonic Shuffle. The game consists of minigames that the player must finish to pass. The story mode is broken up into different tournaments with 3 to 4 players, where 1 to 2 players must finish at least 1st place to pass. Usually, two types of events occur after the player finishes a tournament: a movie featuring the player's character of choice and monkeys, or a cutscene followed by a boss battle, this is the first Ape Escape game to have a rating higher than an E.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ape Escape: Pumped & Primed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87933.name: Constantine
87933.description:
Constantine is an action-adventure video game created as a movie tie-in license of the Warner Bros. film Constantine, in turn based on the Vertigo / DC Comics comic book series, Hellblazer.

Players move John Constantine in an RPG-like style, collecting ammo, using an item to restore health and casting spells. Gameplay is a type of third-person shooter style, with changing camera views. Players can select from a variety of weapons to eliminate demons. Cutscenes initiate special missions or boss battles when they occur, giving a round of gameplay a different view. John can cast spells that can create lightning storms, expel demons, create swarms of flies or confuse enemies. Each requires the player to hit a sequence of keys within a small window of time, with John chanting at each keypress.

Source: Wikipedia, "Constantine (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87935.name: Flash
87935.description:
User Summary

Its 1996 and the war to repel the Earth invaders is still going on. A new combat vehicle has been developed, capable of transforming itself into a laser-armed tank, an helicopter or a grenade-launching jeep. Its up to you to field-test the prototype and destroy as much of the enemy as possible in order to prove the combat effectiveness of the machine.

Flash is a top-down shoot'em up game. The goal is to destroy the many enemy bases across the landscape while avoiding or destroying the opposing infantry and vehicles. The player's vehicle can morph into four different forms: an infantryman with a short-range laser rifle, a tank with a laser cannon (the most powerful weapon available), an helicopter with bombs (fast but vulnerable) and a jeep firing grenades (vulnerable, can fire over obstacles with is not powerful enough to destroy all targets). Each vehicle has its own set of lives and ammunitions. Enemies include foot infantry, tanks, bunkers, several kinds of installations and flying saucers (fast, armoured and deadly).

87936.name: Fusion 2
87936.description:
User Summary

In 2907 the Xylons have been on Earth for a year. Masquerading as an harmless race of alien workers, they have infiltrated every important industry and taken control of all strategic points of the planet. Only you can free your homeworld by entering the Xylon complex, disrupting their computer network and finding a way to overload their fusion reactor.

Fusion 2 is a side-scroller action game. The player explore the Xylon base, destroying defense robots, energy barriers and computers along the way. Once all the computers of the level have been destroyed, the player can use the teleportation machine to go to the next level. There are no power-ups in the game, but the player's hit points and energy levels (used to power the laser gun and the jetpack) are recharged over time.

87937.name: Tribal Dice
87937.description:
Tribal Dice is a unique new solitaire and interactive multiplayer game where players use eight dice with eight sides (8d8) in various colors. The dice represent tribal spirits that must be restored in an ancient ritual to save the tribe and determine the new chieftain. A spirit is fully restored when it shows the highest number, and when it shows that number, each one grants the player a different special power that can be invoked one time to influence the other dice in the game. Players can also re-roll matching dice.

Victory is predicated on strategic planning for which dice to re-roll, when and what order to invoke special powers, and some luck. The solitaire game provides a score, whether won or lost, that a player can attempt to improve over successive games. The multiplayer game has an adjustible game length and a high level of interaction.

Although current electronic implementations of the game allow only solitaire and three player multiplayer, it is possible to play with any number of players, and a special "chaos rule" allows for large groups to play the game without any downtime, as they can invoke their special powers out of turn order.

87941.name: D6 Powers: Revised and Expanded
87941.description:
publisher blurb

D6 POWERS Revised and Expanded is a D6 compatible rule book that allows players to create heroic characters with fantastic powers! Learn more about new and revised super powers, expanded special abilities, gadget creation, advantages and disadvantages for use in any D6 game.
Discover a wealth of information on powers (revised and updated), so many details that it took a whole book to contain them all.

87942.name: Pinball Magic
87942.description:
User Summary

Pinball Magic is a pinball simulation game. There are 12 levels, each with a different machine. The goal on each level is to score points of course, but also to clear the way to the exit hole and send the ball there.

The pinball machines are vintage ones with mushroom bumpers (no multiball or special bonuses), with some gameplay elements borrowed from other computer games (brick walls from breakout, a slot machine in level 4). The player can nudge the machine to change the ball trajectory, but too much nudging and the machine tilts and all bonus points are lost.

Once a level is cleared, gameplay proceeds to the next machine with an extra five balls added. Once the twelfth machine is beaten, the game returns to the first one. The goal of the game is to make it to the high scores list.

87943.name: Miecz Przeznaczenia
87943.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Trzymasz w ręku drugie rozszerzenie gry "Wiedźmin", zaliczane do Biblioteki Białego Wilka. Jest to obszerna, wielowątkowa kampania, której rozegranie zajmie wiele sesji. Znajdziesz tu również rozszerzenia zasad, dzięki którym zabawa nabierze dodatkowego smaczku. Wkrocz przeto do krainy Geralta, w której czekają na Ciebie i Twoich graczy niesamowite niespodzianki, mrożące krew w żyłach wydarzenia i cudowne przygody.

And translation:

This is second sourcebook for "Wiedźmin", part of Library of White Wolf. This is long, multiplot campaign for many sessions. Additionally you will find here additional rules, thanks to which the game will be more satisfying. Enter the world of Gerlat in which there are waiting for you: numerous surprises, bloodcurdling encounters and fantastic adventures.

87945.name: Sliders

videogameversion.75324: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition

87945.description:
User Summary

Sliders is a futuristic soccer game heavily inspired by Marble Madness. Each player (either human or controlled by the computer) controls a ball in a isometric 3d environment and must push another small scoring ball into her scoring zone. Players can either push the small ball or use electromagnetism to either draw the ball to them of shoot it away. The game display a little arrow on top of the player's ball indicating the direction of the scoring ball.

The game includes twelve different levels. A lot of parameters can be customized (gravity, friction, speed, duration of the game...) as well as the camera mode. The game can be played either full screen, or with a split screen view (even for one player games, where it can be configured to show the opponents or the scoring ball).

87946.name: The herring can (Issue 1 - 1988)
87946.description:
Written with typewriter and a few very basic "illustrations".

Contains a mix of wargaming and RPG articles.

Contents
Blubb! - Editorial
Boråscon - Report from gamig event in Borås
Ranking - Squad Leader rankings
Reviews
Rollspel och personer - On the importance of personalities in RPGs
Wettcon 4 - About an upcoming gaming event
GnomeCon - AD&D playing on a convention in Gränna
An untitled article on how to create interesting "dungeons" for Dungeons & Dragons
Tänk efter innan! - On how to keep RPG campaigns interesting

87947.name: Forteresse
87947.description:
User Summary

Gwendoline, daughter of Lord Angkor has been taken prisoner and is trapped in a brass plate armour at the bottom of a dungeon. Your goal is to find the keys to unlock the pieces of the armour and free Gwendoline.

Forteresse is an icon-driven adventure game. The player moves from location to location (each represented by a digitized photograph), collecting items as she goes. There are only six different items, each allowing to unlock new locations and the player can only carry three items at the time. The game also includes three labyrinths that must be crossed before a timer runs out. In order to win the game the player must draw a map and find the correct sequence in which to use the different items and cross the different labyrinths.

87948.name: Han d'Islande

videogameversion.75330: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition

87948.description:
User Summary

Han d'Islande is an adventure game adaptation of the eponymous Victor Hugo novel. In 1699 in Iceland, the young knight and son of the vice roy Ordener Guldenlew finds out his beloved Ethel and her father Schumaker have been falsely accused of treason, arrested and imprisoned in the fortress of Munkholm. Ordener must find a chest containing letters proving Ethel and Schumaker's innocence. Problem is, the chest has been taken by Han, a legendary thief who lives with wolves in a cave in the north of the country.

The game uses a text interpreter for player commands. The display includes a small graphical representation of the current location of the player, and room for several lines of descriptive text. The storyline is close to the novel, with a few tweaks to the story to add a few surprises for those who might have read the book.

Packaging notes:
The game box included an audio tape containing a radio program (from French radio station France Culture and presented by Jacques Chancel) discussing the Victor Hugo book.

87949.name: Grimuar
87949.description:
User Summary:
This is a compilation of articles written in White Dwarf for Warhammer FRP (first edition) and translated and printed in Magia i Miecz.

87950.name: EyeToy: Play

videogamehonor.29367: 2003 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee

87950.description:
EyeToy: Play is a video game for the PlayStation 2, released in 2003. It was the first game to make use of the PlayStation 2's video camera accessory, EyeToy. The game was initially packaged with the EyeToy when the accessory was first released. It features twelve mini-games to choose from. This game, and all other EyeToy titles, are played by moving one's body. The motion is detected by the USB camera. The software recognizes pixel changes in the video image and compares the proximity of the change to other game objects to play the game. Users who get a high score get to take a photo to tease other players.

Source: Wikipedia, "EyeToy: Play", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87951.name: MVP Baseball 2005
87951.description:
MVP Baseball 2005 is a baseball video game that includes all 30 official Major League Baseball teams and stadiums, as well as the more than 1,000 individual players that populate each team. It includes authentic minor league teams and actual minor league players by including double-A and triple-A-level farm teams. 2005's installment includes single-A ball clubs as well (mostly from the Florida State League), giving each MLB team three levels of minor league farm clubs. Two legends teams, 63 legendary players, 15 classic stadiums, five fantasy parks, and more than 100 retro uniforms round out the list of included unlockable features. Rosters are current as of January 12, 2005, and the game included the then new Washington Nationals, along with their then temporary home, RFK Stadium. At the time, new rosters could be downloaded to the Xbox and PS2 versions of the game by accessing their online play menus.

Source: Wikipedia, "MVP Baseball 2005", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87952.name: Seduxion
87952.description:
Seduxion - The game of dice that melts the Ice

The game comes with 8 differnt dice and a scoring pad along with a small rule sheet.

Each of the dice have one face with Lips, Serpents, Apples, fig leaves and Cupids on them. The 6th face contains one letter of the word SEDUXION. 5 of the dice are black the 3 red dice which have the letters S,E,X on it are red. (This combination scores a special bonus)

In turn each player throws all 8 dice and may leave down any, none, or all the dice thrown. Up to 3 rolls are permitted per turn. You get points for more than 3 of the same symbols or have more than 7 differnt faces shown and for making words with at least 3 letters

Example: After 3 rolls you got: 4 Cupids and D, I, E, X. This counts 5 points for the 4 Cupids and 10 points for the word DIE, a total of 15 points. The word SEX gots a special bonus of 30 points.

Every field on the score sheet can be used only once, like in Yatzee. You have to cross out the field on the score sheet. After ten turns one column is finished and the points are calculated together. The games ends here or goes up for 2 other coloums on the same score sheet. The winner of a coloum gets a 50 point bonus.

Should you get SEDUXION at any time this will ends the game and you win the game. In a 3 coloum game the winner takes a 100 point bonus and all other lose their point on that coloum.

(from the rules and user summary)

87953.name: Invitation
87953.description:
User Summary

November 1950. You're a journalist specializing in occult sciences and paranormal phenomena. After receiving a strange telegram signed by "the Count" inviting you to a party in a mansion in the countryside, you drive there, only to find the mansion empty. Now the entrance doors have been locked behind you, and you must fight your way into the house, find weapons and clues and survive until midnight.

Invitation is an adventure game with light RPG elements. The player must explore the rooms of the mansion, fight the creatures and find items and clues. The player has two statistics to manage, physical health and mental health. The game ends when either one drops to zero. Items include weapons, items allowing to destroy instantly a certain type of monster instead of fighting it and codebooks allowing to decipher the clues in the game manual (encoded with a simple alphabet-based cypher). The clues help the player figure out which items are deadly to some creatures, and what needs to be done to finish the game.

87954.name: Cradle of Persia
87954.description:
Persepolis - the mysterious heart of Ancient Persia. The original capital of the Achaemenid Empire was adored with luxurious metals, gems and stone carvings that were set to impress peasants and visiting nobles alike. But its exotic gardens and impressive architecture that once filled this place have long since vanished in the passing sands. Soon you will seek out the riddles of these ruins as you travel through the land of a thousand and one nights. To do this you will need skill and a keen wit, but the result-if you survive-will unlock a mystery never before seen by man, here in the Cradle of Persia game.

With Cradle of Persia you'll travel through 7 historical epochs. As you precede the game more unique and original bonuses will be available for you. Conquer your way through over 100 levels to build 20 masterpieces of Ancient Persia and free the genie from Aladdin's lamp! Unlock the wonders of Persepolis and become Caliph of Persia in this highly addictive puzzle game!

Source: The Developer Website.

87955.name: NFL Street
87955.description:
NFL Street is American football video game. Similar to the Blitz series, Street is seven-on-seven American football, modeled roughly after its informal variant, street football. NFL Players in the game wear street clothing instead of helmets and uniforms (although the players can wear football jerseys). Like other American Football games, NFL Street has basic football rules, but no fouls and low penalty gameplay, naturally leading to much more intense gameplay than its real-life model. However, to maintain the "IronMan" status, there are no injuries in the game.

One important feature in the game is "style points", which the player can earn by successfully completing style moves (which includes making a huge play or taunting the other team during the game). Enough style points will earn the player a ‘'Gamebreaker’’, which lasts for the entire drive. The Gamebreaker concept was taken from NBA Street.

Game modes
Quick Game — In this mode you select a team and play a quick game against either the computer or a friend. The scoring system can be in touchdowns or style points, depending on the choice of the player.

Pickup Game — A Pickup Game is the same as a Quick Game, but instead of choosing a team, you and your opponent create teams from a pool of around 40 NFL players, some of which are Legends. In game, the teams are referred as "Team One" and "Team Two".

NFL Challenge — This is the main mode in the game. You create a team, from logo to players height, and go through a series of challenges against other teams, unlocking new football stadiums, teams, equipment, and development points for improving your team;by completing several chalanges that vary in their difficulty

All NFL Pickup — To unlock this mode, you must first beat the NFL Challenge mode. The same features apply as in Pickup Game, but instead of a 40 player pool, you can select from any of the players in the game, including Legends.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL Street", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87956.name: Sega Classics Collection
87956.description:
Sega Classics Collection is a PlayStation 2 compilation that contains new 3D versions of classic Sega titles. The original games were released separately as part of the Sega Ages games in Japan. This game is not to be confused with the similarly titled Sega Genesis Collection, which contains 28 classic games in their original form. Three of the games in this collection, (Bonanza Bros, Columns, Golden Axe) appeared in the Sega Genesis Collection.

List of Games:

Monaco GP (Vol. 2)
Fantasy Zone (Vol. 3)
Space Harrier (Vol. 4)
Golden Axe (Vol. 5)
Bonanza Bros. (Also includes Tant-R)
Columns (Vol. 7)
Virtua Racing (Vol. 8)
Out Run (Vol. 13)
Alien Syndrome (US only)

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Classics Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87957.name: The Gauntlet
87957.description:
In the dark depths of a drifting space wreck, a small team of specialists investigates unusual scanner readings of life on board. The team acts relaxed; banter hides their anxiety. Motion scanners show nothing; torches illuminate the dank corridor casting long shadows.

Suddenly the point man's scanner shows movement ahead, increasing in speed. His reflexes are conditioned by experience, so he shoulders the carbine. The torch illuminates a horrific shape. Recognising danger the point man fires the carbine in a rapid series of bursts.

An alien screeches of pain and the creature falls to the ground. You have just made first contact.

More motion scanners come to life, movement all around you starts closing in through the maze of ship's corridors. This is more than five men can handle. It is time to withdraw back to the assault shuttle.

What is The Gauntlet?

The Gauntlet is a print 'n play board game for 1-6 players. Designed as an entertaining tactical-action and strategy game, the game is based around teaching leadership concepts and team work.

Players are tasked with a simple mission, get the team to safety. Players choose their leaders and role within the team, each team character has unique skills or abilities which can be used to advantage by the team and individual. The teams leader guides the play of the game, allowing the individuals to create team work to support each other.

The play is fast and furious, players quickly mastering the simple mechanics designed to focus the players on making decisions than working out how to play. Within minutes players will be talking, making decisions and blasting aliens.

The game is over in 35 turns or 45 minutes, whichever comes first.

The Gauntlet is even suitable for solo play.

What do I get?

The game is available in a downloadable PDF format. You have the choice as to how the game will be printed and presented to fit your needs. The game includes;

+ a complete full colour board detailing a section of the space ship.

+ stand-up counters for the humans and aliens.

+ 3d components (containers, boxes and rubble).

+ optional 3d components to create the walls and structure of the space ship.

+ a complete rules guide with examples of play.

+ a guide to assembly.

Not included are six (6) regular six-sided dice (the game can be played with less, six being the ideal).

The game may be produced with the minimal components or with option 3d componentry that creates an incredible game board that gives the game an incredible look and feel.

You can print the game on your own colour printer or have it proffessionally printed by a 3rd party printing service. A heavy card stock of around 200gsm is reccommended. The board could be printed on full page label stock. In either case they can be mounted on very heavy cardboard, wood sheets or even foam boards.

Assembly is quick and easy.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

87958.name: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs
87958.description:
SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs is a tactical third-person shooter video game developed by Zipper Interactive and published by Sony Computer Entertainment. It is an exclusive title for the PlayStation 2. SOCOM was released on August 27, 2002, and it is one of the earliest online titles available for the PS2's online adapter. In addition to the 12 offline single player missions, SOCOM also features online play via the internet at no additional charge to the customer. SOCOM additionally uses a USB headset for its speech recognition commands offline, and allows voice chat with teammates when playing online; this was the first game for the PS2 to use the headset.

SOCOM takes its name from the abbreviation for the United States Special Operations Command. The player leads a four-man team (three AI-controlled teammates) of United States Navy SEALs through 12 missions in four regions: Alaska, Thailand, Congo, and Turkmenistan in the years 2006 and 2007. In the single player missions, commands can be spoken using the included USB headset or via an onscreen menu if the optional SOCOM headset was not purchased. Typical missions consist of killing terrorists, rescuing hostages, retrieving intelligence, or destroying terrorist bases.

Source: Wikipedia, "SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87959.name: Whiplash
87959.description:
Whiplash is a platformer video game for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox where a long-tailed weasel chained to a rabbit must work together to escape from a product testing corporation.

Although Redmond (the rabbit) and Spanx (the weasel) are two animals chained together, the gameplay is much like any other platformer. The player controls only Spanx, using Redmond as a weapon or tool as the situation requires. Spanx has most standard platforming abilities, while Redmond is completely indestructible as a result of tests conducted upon him and so can be hurled into security guards, jammed into machinery, and used as a grappling hook, among other uses. Redmond can be inserted into special outlets to be set on fire, frozen, or become radioactive.

One unique aspect of the game is that many objects through the levels are breakable and are assigned a dollar amount which is tracked by the game; by completing the game with more than $6 million in damage, special content can be unlocked.
